<p>2. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Anpassning a i punkt 25 (rådets förordning (EEG) nr 1382/91) skall utgå.</p>

<p>om avlämnande av statistikuppgifter om nominell fångst för medlemsstater<br>som bedriver fiske i Nordatlantens östra del (EGT nr L 365, 31.12.1991,<br>s. 1)</p>
<p>Bestämmelserna i förordningen skall, inom ramen för detta avtal, tillämpas<br>med följande anpassningar:</p>
<p>a) &nbsp;&nbsp;EFTA-statema skall oavsett den bestämmelse som antagits enligt<br>Europeiska gemenskapens gemensamma fiskepolitik tillatas tillämpa<br>urvalstekniker enligt det villkor som anges i artikel 3 första meningen<br>andra delen.</p>
<p>b) &nbsp;&nbsp;EFTA-statema skall samla in de uppgifter som krävs i denna<br>förordning med början senast 1995. Den rapport som avses i artikel</p>
<p>6.1 skall överlämnas av EFTA-statema senast i slutet av 1995.</p>
<p>25b. &nbsp;&nbsp;393 R 2018: Rådets förordning (EEG) nr 2018/93 av den 30 juni 1993 om</p>
<p>rapportering av statistikuppgifter om medlemsstaternas fångster och<br>fiskeriaktiviteter i Nordatlantens västra del (EGT nr L 186, 28.7.1993, s. 1)</p>
<p>Bestämmelserna i förordningen skall, inom ramen för detta avtal, tillämpas<br>med följande anpassningar:</p>
<p>a) &nbsp;&nbsp;EFTA-statema skall oavsett den bestämmelse som antagits enligt<br>Europeiska gemenskapens gemensamma fiskepolitik tillåtas tillämpa<br>urvalstekniker enligt det villkor som anges i artikel 3 första meningen<br>andra delen.</p>
<p>b) &nbsp;&nbsp;EFTA-statema skall samla in de uppgifter som krävs i denna<br>förordning med böljan senast 1995. Den rapport som avses i artikel</p>
<p>7.1 skall överlämnas av EFTA-statema senast i slutet av 1995.&quot;</p>

<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 1</h3>
<p>Bilaga 20</p>
<p>till Gemensamma<br>EES-kommittens beslut nr 7/94</p>
<p>Rilaga XXII (ROIAGSRÄTT) till EES-avtalet skall ändras på följande sätt.</p>
<p>RÄTTSAKTER SOM DET HÄNVISAS TILL</p>
<p>1. Följande strecksats skall laggas lill i punkt 2 (rådets andra direktiv 77/91/EEG) före</p>
<p>anpassningarna:</p>
<p>392 L 0101: Rådets direktiv 92/101 /EEG av den 23 november 1992 (EGT nr L<br>347. 28 11.1992. s. 64)&quot;.</p>
<p>252</p>
<p>Prop. 1993/94:203</p>
<p>Bilaga 1</p>
<p>GEMENSAMT UTTALANDE OM VIDARE INFÖRLIVANDE I AVTALET AV RELEVANTA<br>GEMENSKAPSRÄTTSAKTER</p>
<p>Gemensamma EES-kommittén beaktar det faktum att ett antal rättsakter som antagits före den 31<br>december 1993 och som har betydelse for EES inte har tagits upp på den aktuella förteckningen över<br>gemenskapsrätt sakter.</p>
<p>De avtalsslutande parterna är överens om att dessa rättsakter bör granskas av Gemensamma kommittén<br>i syfte att införliva dem i avtalet så snart som möjligt.</p>
<p>253</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 1</h3>
<p>GEMENSAMT UTTALANDE OM SKYDDSÅTGÄRDER PÅ VETERINÄROMRÅDET</p>
<p>De avtalsslutande parterna</p>
<p>är medvetna om att punkt 9 i inledningen till kapitel I i bilaga I till EES-avtalet innehåller<br>bestämmelser om skyddsåtgärder som de avtalsslutande parterna kan vidta under särskilda<br>förhållanden,</p>
<p>är medvetna om att det faktum att de avtalsslutande parterna på EFTA-sidan inte har tillgång till<br>gemenskapsfinansiering för utrotning av djursjukdomar som kan bryta ut kommer att beaktas när<br>skyddsåtgärder vidtas för att förhindra att sjukdomarna i fråga sprider sig till deras territorier,</p>
<p>är överens om att sådana åtgärder skall vara av begränsad tidsmässig och geografisk omfattning,</p>
<p>noterar att de berörda EFTA-statema förbehåller sig rätten att, vid fall av klassisk svinpest eller<br>vesikulär svinsjuka, tillämpa särskilda skyddsåtgärder för de berörda områdena och att de har för<br>avsikt att fortsätta med dessa åtgärder under en period på minst 12 månader efter det sista utbrottet,</p>
<p>noterar vidare att Europeiska unionen förbehåller sig rätten att begära samråd i enlighet med punkt 1 b<br>i ovannämnda punkt 9.</p>
<p>254</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 1</h3>
<p>UTTALANDE AV NORGES REGERING OM INFEKTIÖS LAXANEMI</p>
<p>Norge accepterar införlivandet i avtalet av rådets direktiv 93/54/EEG om ändring av direktiv<br>91/67/EEG om djurhälsovillkor för utsläppande på marknaden av djur och produkter från vattenbruk,<br>men vill ända uttrycka sin fasta övertygelse, grundad på nu tillgänglig kunskap om epidemiologin hos<br>infektiös laxanemi (ISA) och på den klart bevisade praktiska effekten av veterinära kontrollåtgärder,<br>att det inte finns något vetenskapligt berättigande för att klassificera ISA som en allvarlig exotisk<br>sjukdom.</p>
<p>255</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 1</h3>
<p>UTTALANDE AV ÖSTERRIKES REGERING</p>
<p>OM GENETISKT MODIFIERADE MIKROORGANISMER SOM ANVÄNDS VID<br>PRODUKTION AV JORDBRUKSPRODUKTER OCH LIVSMEDEL<br>(rådets förordning (EEG) nr 2092/91)</p>
<p>De österrikiska myndigheterna noterar att genetiskt modifierade mikroorganismer enligt rådets direktiv<br>90/220/EEG inte godkänts for förteckningen över tillatna ingredienser i ekologiskt producerade<br>livsmedel.</p>
<p>Om bestämmelser antas i syfte att lista genetiskt modifierade mikroorganismer i enlighet med det<br>förfarande som fastställs i artikel 14, kommer Österrikes fasta hållning att vara att, inom ramen för<br>avtalets förfaranden, motsätta sig märkning med &quot;ekologiskt producerad&quot; eller varje liknande<br>märkning, av produkter som innehaller, består av eller har producerats med hjälp av genetiskt<br>modifierade mikroorganismer enligt direktiv 90/220/EEG.</p>
<p>256</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 1</h3>
<p>GEMENSAMT UTTALANDE</p>
<p>OM VARVSINDUSTRI</p>
<p>Gemensamma EES-kommittén beaktar att det sjunde varvsindustridirektivet (90/684/EEG) har<br>förlängts till och med utgången av 1994 genom rådets direktiv 93/115/EG av den 16 december 1993.<br>Det förutsätts att den gemensamma förklaringen om varvsindustri och förklaringen av Europeiska<br>gemenskapen om varvsindustri, som båda utgör tillägg till Avtalet om Europeiska ekonomiska<br>samarbetsområdet, undertecknat i Oporto den 2 maj 1992, skall fortsätta att gälla till och med<br>utgången av 1994. Om det sjunde varvsindustridirektivet skulle förlängas ytterligare efter 1994 års<br>utgång eller ersättas av ett nytt direktiv, skall det gällande direktivet införlivas i EES-avtalet med<br>verkan från och med den 1 januari 1995.</p>
<p>257</p>
<p>17 Riksdagen 1993/94. 1 saml. Nr 203. Bilagor</p>
<p>Rättelse: S. 270 rad 7, S. 271 rad 9 Står: 5 Rättad till: 6</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 1</h3>
<p>GEMENSAMT UTTALANDE</p>
<p>OM GEMENSKAPENS RÄTTSAKTER INOM OMRÅDET FÖR GEOGRAFISKA<br>BETECKNINGAR, URSPRUNGSBETECKNINGAR OCH INTYG OM SÄRART FÖR<br>JORDBRUKSPRODUKTER OCH LIVSMEDEL</p>
<p>1. &nbsp;&nbsp;I rådets förordning (EEG) nr 2081/92 och rådets förordning (EEG) nr 2082/92 beaktas de<br>aspekter som är av intresse för tredje land vid genomförandet av gemenskapens system för<br>geografiska beteckningar och ursprungsbeteckningar samt av gemenskapens system för intyg om<br>särart, genom att garantier gällande förfaranden för invändning och möjligheten att erhålla skydd<br>föreskrivs. Dessa garantier är följande i rådets förordning (EEG) nr 2081/92:</p>
<p>1 artikel 7 punkt 3 ges varje lagligen berörd intresserad person möjlighet att framställa<br>invändning mot en ansökan om gemenskapsregistrering. Kommissionen har uppfattningen<br>att, om invändningen grundar sig på att det finns en produkt med identiskt eller snarlikt<br>namn som lagligen marknadsförs vid den tidpunkt da förordningen offentliggörs, skall<br>gemenskapsimportören - om det rör sig om importerade produkter - anses vara lagligen<br>berörd i samma utsträckning som tillverkare av produkter inom gemenskapen.</p>
<p>Vad gäller varumärken skall artikeln tolkas på så sätt att varje innehavare av ett varumärke<br>som är registrerat i en medlemsstat skall tillatas invända mot en registrering.</p>
<p>Inom ramen för diskussionerna om gemenskapsskvdd för tredje lands beteckningar ges i<br>artikel 122.2 regler som gör det möjligt att lösa fall av sammanfallande skyddade<br>beteckningar pa produkter i gemenskapen och i tredje land.</p>
<p>2. &nbsp;&nbsp;Gemenskapen och EFTA-statema skall se över situationen beträffande rådets förordningar (EEG)<br>nr 2081/92 och nr 2082/92 när de beteckningar som avses i artikel 17.1 i rädets förordning<br>(EEG) nr 2081/92 skal) registreras i enlighet med det förfarande som fastställs i artikel 17 2 i<br>denna förordning.</p>
<p>258</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 1</h3>
<p>UTTALANDE AV ÖSTERRIKES REGERING</p>
<p>OM DEN SPECIFIKA MIGRATIONSGRÄNSEN FÖR 1,4-DIKLORBENSEN<br>(kommissionens direktiv 93/9/EEG)</p>
<p>Österrike accepterar den specifika migrationsgränsen på 12 mg/kg för 1,4-diklorbensen enligt avsnitt<br>A i bilaga 1 till direktiv 93/9/EEG, under förutsättning att man har möjlighet att när som helst kräva<br>en översyn av denna gräns på grundval av vetenskapliga bevis eller resonemang. Österrike anser att<br>man vid en sådan översyn måste ta hänsyn till de resultat av relevanta studier som kan bli tillgängliga<br>i framtiden och även göra en grundlig jämförelse mellan och en kritisk utvärdering av de olika<br>metoderna för val av provexemplar, provtagning, analys, datautvärdering och tolkning, i syfte att<br>säkerställa att de mest noggranna och tillförlitliga testmetoderna används.</p>
<p>259</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 1</h3>
<p>GEMENSAMT UTTALANDE<br>om vissa rättsakter inom<br>området för social trygghet</p>
<p>Godtagandet av rådets förordning (EEG) nr 1247/93, nr 1248/93, nr 1249/93<br>och nr 1945/93 skall inte hindra Finland, Island, Norge och Sverige att<br>tillämpa sina respektive gamla regler, om dessa är mer gynnsamma för de<br>berörda personerna, tills Gemensamma EES-kommitténs beslut nr [..]/[94]<br>träder i kraft.</p>
<p>260</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 1</h3>
<p>GEMENSAMT UTTALANDE<br>OM DE AV ISLANDS MEDBORGARE</p>
<p>SOM HAR EXAMENS- ELLER UTBILDNINGSBEVIS SOM UTFÄRDATS EFTER<br>FULLFÖLJANDE AV EN BEHÖRIGHETSGIVANDE HÖGRE UTBILDNING I TREDJE LAND</p>
<p>Med beaktande av att rådets direktiv 92/51/EEG av den 18 juni 1992 om<br>en andra generell ordning för erkännande av behörighetsgivande högre<br>utbildning, en ordning som kompletterar den som föreskrivs i direktiv<br>89/48/EEG (EGT nr L 209, 24.7.1992, s. 25), i den lydelse det har då<br>det anpassats till EES, avser examens-, utbildnings- och andra<br>behörighetsbevis som huvudsakligen utfärdas av de avtalsslutande<br>parterna.</p>
<p>Det är dock angeläget att ta hänsyn till den särskilda ställning som de<br>av Islands medborgare har som, på grund av begränsade möjligheter till<br>behörighetsgivande högre utbildning och en lång tradition av att<br>bedriva sådana studier utomlands, har studerat i tredje land.</p>
<p>De avtalsslutande parterna rekommenderar härmed de berörda regeringarna<br>att tillåta de av Islands medborgare som har ett examens- eller<br>utbildningsbevis som omfattas av den generella ordningen, och som har<br>utfärdats i tredje land och som erkänns av Islands behöriga<br>myndigheter, att inom Europeiska ekonomiska samarbetsområdet utöva<br>yrket i fråga, genom att erkänna dessa examensbevis inom sina<br>territorier.</p>
<p>261</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 1</h3>
<p>GEMENSAMT UTTALANDE</p>
<p>OM SYSSELSÄTTNING SOM BYGGNADSARBETARE</p>
<p>PÅ ISLAND</p>
<p>De avtalsslutande parterna som beaktar att</p>
<p>artikel 2 i rådets direktiv 92/51/EEG av den 18 juni 1992 om en<br>andra generell ordning för erkännande av behörighetsgivande<br>högre utbildning, en ordning som kompletterar den som föreskrivs<br>i direktiv 89/48/EEG (EGT nr L 209, 24.7.1992, s. 25), i den<br>lydelse det har då det har anpassats till EES, fastställer att<br>direktivet inte är tillämpligt på den verksamhet som omfattas av<br>ett direktiv i förteckningen i bilaga A,</p>
<p>artikel 2 i rådets direktiv 92/51/EEG dessutom anger att<br>direktiven i förteckningen i bilaga B skall göras tillämpliga på<br>anställda inom sådan verksamhet som omfattas av dessa direktiv,</p>
<p>rådets direktiv 64/427/EEG av den 7 juli 1964 med detaljbe-<br>stämmelser om övergångsåtgärder för egenföretagare inom<br>tillverknings- och processindustrin inom ISIC-huvudgrupperna 23-<br>40 ingår i de direktiv som finns förtecknade i bilagorna A och<br>B,</p>
<p>verksamhet inom byggnadssektorn, antingen som anställd eller<br>egenföretagare, följaktligen skall styras av bestämmelserna i<br>direktiv 64/427/EEG i den lydelse det har då det anpassats till<br>EES, och inte av direktiv 92/51/EEG,</p>
<p>som dock är angelägna att uppmärksamma de exceptionella geologiska och<br>meteorologiska förhållanden som råder på Island och de krav som<br>följaktligen ställs på hantverkares skicklighet, särskilt med avseende på<br>valet av material och skyddsåtgärder som behövs på grund av samverkan<br>mellan jordbävningar, kraftigt regn och plötsliga temperaturväxlingar, och</p>
<p>som inser att det i enlighet med regeln om samma behandling som landets<br>medborgare, av migrerande från andra EFTA-stater eller från EG-<br>medlemsstater kommer att krävas att de följer isländska<br>byggnadsbestämmelser och att ett brott mot dessa bestämmelser kan leda<br>till disciplinära åtgärder i fråga om yrkesutövning och/eller åtal,</p>
<p>rekommenderar härmed de berörda regeringarna att informera de av sina<br>medborgare som önskar ta anställning som byggnadsarbetare på Island i<br>enlighet med bestämmelserna i direktiv 64/427/EEG, i den lydelse det har<br>då det anpassats till EES, om det tillrådliga i att genomgå särskild<br>utbildning för att tillägna sig den särskilda yrkesskicklighet som krävs<br>för att arbeta under de geografiska och meteorologiska förhållanden som<br>råder på Island och de byggnadsbestämmelser som tillämpas där.</p>
<p>262</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 1</h3>
<p>GEMENSAMT UTTALANDE</p>
<p>om rådets direktiv 92/96/EEG</p>
<p>(ny punkt 12a i bilaga IX till EES-avtalet)</p>
<p>Vid samtycket till den övergångsperiod som anges i anpassning<br>b till rådets direktiv 92/96/EEG (den nya punkten 12a i bilaga<br>IX till EES-avtalet), har utgångspunkten varit att den<br>gällande svenska lagstiftningen angående obligationer utgivna<br>av bostadsfinansieringsinstitut har inslag av skydd för<br>obligationsinnehavaren som är jämförbara med dem som anges i<br>artikel 22.4 i detta direktiv, varför denna lagstiftning bör<br>vara i kraft under övergångsperioden.</p>
<p>I detta sammanhang framförde Sverige att det är den svenska<br>regeringens ambition att avveckla det särskilda systemet för<br>stöd till den finansiella sektorn så snart som möjligt.<br>Systemet skall finnas kvar så länge som det behövs och skall<br>inte avvecklas förrän det kan göras utan att borgenärens rätt<br>äventyras.</p>
<p>Vad avser de exponeringar som för närvarande överstiger 20% är<br>de svenska myndigheterna och gemenskapen överens om att de bör<br>minskas till 20% eller mindre senast den 1 juli 1996 och, om<br>möjligt, före den 31 december 1995.</p>
<p>263</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 1</h3>
<p>GEMENSAMT UTTALANDE</p>
<p>om rådets förordning (EEG) nr 3118/93 (den nya punkten 26c i bilaga<br>XIII till EES-avtalet)</p>
<p>De avtalsslutande parterna Är eniga om att det avtal om antalet<br>cabotagetillstånd för vägtransporter för EFTA-staterna och fördelningen<br>av dessa som har ingétts mellan parterna inte på något sÄtt skall<br>föregripa eventuella motsvarande diskussioner eller avtal i andra<br>sammanhang.</p>
<p>264</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 1</h3>
<p>UTTALANDE AV DE BERÖRDA EFTA-LÄNDERNA</p>
<p>om rådets direktiv 93/89/EEG</p>
<p>(den nya punkten 18a i bilaga XIII till EES-avtalet)</p>
<p>Rådets direktiv 93/89/EEG är av vikt för att den integrerade marknaden<br>för godstransporter på väg skall fungera i sin helhet. De berörda EFTA-<br>staterna önskar därför tillämpa rådets direktiv 93/89/EEG, i dess<br>lydelse efter anpassning till EES-avtalet. Detta påverkar inte<br>samförståndet om att harmoniseringen av beskattning som sådan inte<br>omfattas av EES-avtalet.</p>
<p>Detta uttalande påverkar inte tillämpningen av artikel 118 i EES-<br>avtalet.</p>
<p>265</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 1</h3>
<p>UTTALANDE AV SVERIGES REGERING</p>
<p>om rådets direktiv 92/143/EEG</p>
<p>(den nya punkten 59a i bilaga XIII till EES-avtalet)</p>
<p>Svenska kustvatten bevakas av navigeringssystemet Decca som kan användas<br>ytterligare någon tid efter år 2000. Inget ytterligare system behövs för<br>den del av den svenska sjöfarten som bevakas av Decca-systemet. Med<br>beaktande av rådets beslut 92/143/EEG kommer Sverige inte att införa<br>systemet Loran-C eller finansiellt stödja främjandet av Loran-C någon<br>annanstans.</p>
<p>266</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 1</h3>
<p>UTTALANDE AV DE AVTALSSLUTANDE PARTERNA</p>
<p>om rådets förordning (EEG) nr 3577/92<br>(den nya punkten 53a i bilaga XIII till EES-avtalet)</p>
<p>Genom att artikel 1.21 rådets förordning (EEG) nr 3577/92 inte tillämpas<br>inom ramen för detta avtal, skall &quot;vid den aktuella tidpunkten&quot; i artikeln<br>anses hänvisa till den 1 januari 1993, i enlighet med det datum som anges<br>i artikel 1.1.</p>
<p>Gemenskapen uppmärksammar den norska regeringens uttalande om att den inte<br>avser att ändra sin inhemska lagstiftning i fråga om det norska<br>internationella skeppsregistret före den 1 januari 1997. Under mellantiden<br>skall gemenskapen erkänna Norges särskilda intresse för gemenskapens<br>arbete i fråga om marknadstillträde för fartyg som inte uppfyller alla<br>villkor för att tillåtas bedriva cabotagetrafik i flaggstaten. Norge<br>kommer att delta i detta arbete enligt bestämmelserna i avtalet.</p>
<p>267</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 1</h3>
<p>17.2.1994</p>
<p>GEMENSAMT UTTALANDE<br>om autentifieringen av texterna till de EG-rättsakter som anges i<br>bilagorna till Gemensamma EES-kommitténs beslut nr .../94</p>
<p>De avtasslutande partema är överens om att Gemennsamma EES-kommittén, senast när beslut nr<br>,../94 träder i kraft, skall besluta om autentiferingen av texterna till de EG-rättsakter som det hänvisas<br>till i bilagorna till detta beslut, vilka har utarbetats på finska, isländska, norska och svenska.</p>
<p>268</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>DECISION OF THE EEA JOINT COMMITTEE</p>
<p>No 7/94</p>
<p>of 21 March 1994<br></p>
<p>amending Protocol 47 and certain Annexes<br>to the EEA Agreement</p>
<p>THE EEA JOINT COMMITTEE,</p>
<p>HAVING REGARD to the Agreement on the European Economic Area (EEA), as adjusted by<br>the Protocol Adjusting the Agreement on the European Economic Area, hereinafter together<br>referred to as the Agreement, and in particular Article 98 thereof,</p>
<p>RECALLING that the objective of the Contracting Parties to the Agreement is to establish a<br>dynamic and homogeneous European Economic Area, based on common rules and equal<br>treatment of individuals and economic operators as regards the four freedoms and the<br>conditions of competition as well as on strengthened and broadened co-operation in flanking<br>and horizontal policies,</p>
<p>269</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203<br>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>NOTING that the Agreement contains references to EC acts of EEA relevance issued by the<br>European Community before 1 August 1991,</p>
<p>CONSIDERING that, in order to guarantee the homogeneity of the Agreement and the legal<br>security for individuals and economic operators, and in the light of the joint examination by<br>the Contracting Parties of acts issued by the European Community after 31 July 1991, the<br>Agreement needs to be amended,</p>
<p>CONSIDERING furthermore that the specific nature of the acts mentioned in Annex 6 to this<br>Decision require the simultaneous application of these acts within the Community and<br>the EEA from the date of the entry into force of the EEA Agreement,</p>
<p>RECALLING that according to Protocol 1 to the Agreement provisions of the acts referred to<br>in the Annexes to the Agreement shall be applicable in accordance with the Agreement and<br>Protocol 1, unless otherwise provided in the respective Annex,</p>
<p>HAS DECIDED AS FOLLOWS:</p>
<p>Article 1</p>
<p>Protocol 47 and Annexes I, II, IV to IX, XI and XIII to XXII to the Agreement shall be<br>amended as specified in Annexes 1 to 20 to this Decision.</p>
<p>270</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>Artide 2</p>
<p>1. Unless othew e provided in the Annexes to this Decision, dates conceming the entry into<br>force or impleme ation of the acts mentioned in these Annexes shall, for the purposes of the<br>Agreement, be read as follows:</p>
<p>where the date of entry into force or implementation of the act precedes the date of entry<br>into force of this Decision, the date of entry into force of this Decision shall apply;</p>
<p>where the date of entry into force or implementation of the act is after the date of entry into<br>force of this Decision, the date of entry into force or implementation of the act shall apply.</p>
<p>2. The acts mentioned and the provisions laid down in Annex 6 to this Decision shall be<br>applicable from the date of the entry into force of the Agreement.</p>
<p>Article 3</p>
<p>This Decision shall enter into force on 1 July 1994, provided that all the notifications required<br>under Article 103(1) of the Agreement have been made to the EEA Joint Committee.</p>
<p>271</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>Article 4</p>
<p>This Decision shall be published in the EEA Section of, and the EEA Supplement to, the</p>
<p>Official Journal of the European Communities.</p>
<p>Done at Brussels,</p>
<p>1994</p>
<p>For the EEA Joint Committee</p>
<p>The President</p>
<p>N.G. van der Pas</p>
<p>The Secretaries to</p>
<p>the EEA Joint Committee</p>
<p>P.K. Mannes M. Sucker</p>
<p>272</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>Annex 1</p>
<p>to Decision No 7/94<br>of the EEA Joint Committee</p>
<p>PROTOCOL 47 ON THE ABOLITION OF TECHNICAL BARRIERS TO TRADE IN WINE to the<br>EEA Agreement shall be amended as as specified below.</p>

<p>1. The main part shall be amended as follows:</p>

<p>(b) The following shall be inserted as a new second paragraph:</p>
<p>'The Contracting Partias shall establish mutual assistance between control<br>authorities in the wine sector in accordance with the provisions laid down in<br>Appendix 2.&quot;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;In the last paragraph the words 'the Appendix&quot; shall be replaced by &quot;Appendix 1&quot;.</p>

<p>&quot;ACTS OF WHICH THE CONTRACTING PARTIES SHALL TAKE NOTE</p>
<p>The Contracting Parties take note of the content of the following acts:</p>
<p>43. List published pursuant to Article 22 of Commission Regulation (EEC) No 986/89 of<br>10 April 1989 on the accompanying documents for carriage of wine products and<br>the relevant records to be kept (OJ No C 330, 19.12.1991, p. 3).</p>

<p>46. List of Austrian wines (OJ No C...).&quot;.</p>
<p>C. The following shall be added to the Protocol as a new Appendix 2:</p>
<p>•APPENDIX 2</p>
<p>Establishing mutual assistance between control authorities in the wine sector</p>
<p>Title I</p>
<p>Preliminary Provisions</p>
<p>Article 1</p>
<p>Definitions</p>
<p>For the purposes of this Appendix:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;&quot;rules conceming trade in wine&quot; shall mean any provision laid down in this Protocol;</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;&quot;competent authority&quot; shall mean each of the authorities or each of the departments<br>designated by a Contracting Party to ensure compliance with the rules conceming trade<br>in wine;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;&quot;liaison authority* shall mean the competent body or authority designated by a<br>Contracting Party to liaise as appropriate with the liaison authorities of other Contracting<br>Parties;</p>
<p>280</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203<br>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>(d) 'applicant authority’ shall mean a competent authority which has been designated by a<br>Contracting Party for this purpose and which makes a request for assistance in areas<br>covered by this Appendix;</p>
<p>&lt;e) &quot;requested authority’ shall mean a competent body or authority which has been<br>designated by a Contracting Party for this purpose and which receives a request for<br>assistance in areas covered by this Appendix;</p>
<p>(f&gt; &quot;contravention” shall mean any violation of the rules conceming trade in wine, as well as<br>any attempted violation of such rules.</p>
<p>Article 2</p>
<p>Scope</p>
<p>1. &nbsp;The Contracting Parties shall assist each other, in the manner and under the conditions<br>laid down in this Appendix. The correct application of the rules conceming trade in wine<br>shall be ensured in particular through mutual assistance, detection and investigation of<br>contraventions of these rules.</p>
<p>2. &nbsp;Assistance in matters conceming such rules, as provided for in this Appendix, shall apply<br>to any authority of the Contracting Parties. It shall not prejudice the rules relating to<br>criminal proceedings or mutual assistance among Contracting Parties at judicial level in<br>criminal matters.</p>
<p>281</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>Title II</p>
<p>Controls to be carried out by the</p>
<p>Contracting Parties</p>
<p>Article 3</p>
<p>Principles</p>
<p>1. &nbsp;The Contracting Parties shall take the necessary measures to ensure the assistance, as<br>provided for in Article 2, through appropriate control measures.</p>
<p>2. &nbsp;&nbsp;Such Controls shall be carried out either systematically or by sampling. In the case of<br>sampling, Contracting Parties shall ensure by their number, nature and frequency that<br>Controls are representative.</p>
<p>3. &nbsp;Contracting Parties shall ensure that the competent authorities have a sufficient number<br>of suitable, qualified and experienced staff to carry out efficiently the Controls referred to<br>in paragraph 1. They shall take all appropriate measures to facilitate the work of the<br>officials of their competent authorities, in particular with regard to the following<br>purposes:</p>
<p>- having access to the vineyards, wine-making and storage installations and for<br>installations for Processing wine-sector products and vehicles for transporting those<br>products;</p>
<p>- having access to the commercial premises (or warehouses) and vehicles of anyone<br>holding, with a view to sale, marketing or transporting wine-sector products or<br>products which may be intended for use in the wine sector;</p>
<p>282</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>- having the possibility of undertaking a survey of wine-sector products and substances<br>or products which may be used for the preparation of such products:</p>
<p>- having the possibility of taking samples of products held with a view to sale,<br>marketed or transported:</p>
<p>- having the possibility of examining accounts or other documents for the purposes of<br>Controls and of taking copies or extracts thereof;</p>
<p>- having the possibility of taking appropriate protective measures regarding the<br>preparation, holding, transport, description, presentation, export to other Contracting<br>Parties and marketing of a wine-sector product or a product intended for use in the<br>preparation of such a product, if there is reason to believe that there has been a<br>serious infringement of this Protocol, in particular in the case of fraudulent treatment<br>or risks to public health.</p>
<p>Article 4</p>
<p>Control authorities</p>
<p>1, &nbsp;Where a Contracting Party designates several competent authorities, it shall ensure the<br>co-ordination of the work of those authorities.</p>
<p>2. &nbsp;&nbsp;Each Contracting Party shall designate a single liaison authority. The authority<br>designated shall:</p>
<p>- forward the applications for cooperation with a view to implementing this Appendix<br>to the liaison authorities of other Contracting Parties;</p>
<p>283</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>- receive such applications from the latter authorities and forward them to the<br>competent authority or authorities of the Contracting Party concerned under which it<br>comes;</p>
<p>- represent that Contracting Party vis-å-vis other Contracting Parties in the context of<br>the co-operation covered by Title III;</p>
<p>- notify the other Contracting Parties of the measures taken pursuant to Article 3.</p>
<p>Title III</p>
<p>Mutual assistance between control authorities</p>
<p>Article 5</p>
<p>Assistance on request</p>
<p>1. &nbsp;At the request of the applicant authority, the requested authority shall furnish it with all<br>relevant information to enable it to verify the correct application of the rules conceming<br>trade in wine, including information conceming operations noted or planned which<br>contravene or would contravene such rules.</p>
<p>2. &nbsp;At the reasoned request of the applicant authority, the requested authority shall perform<br>or take necessary steps to perform special surveillance or Controls enabling the desired<br>objectives to be achieved.</p>
<p>3. &nbsp;The requested authority as referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2 shall act as if on its own<br>account or at the request of an authority in its own country.</p>
<p>284</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203<br>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>4. &nbsp;In agreement with the requested authority, the applicant authority may designate its<br>own officials or officials of another competent authority of the Contracting Party it<br>represents:</p>
<p>- either to obtain on the premises of the competent authorities coming under the</p>
<p>Contracting Party in which the requested authority has its seat, information relating<br>to the verification of the correct application of the rules conceming trade in wine or to<br>control activities, including the making of copies of transport and other documents or<br>extracts from the register;</p>
<p>- or to be present during activities requested pursuant to paragraph 2.</p>
<p>The copies referred to in the first indent may be made only with the agreement of the<br>requested authority.</p>
<p>5. &nbsp;An applicant authority which wishes to send to a Contracting Party an official<br>designated in accordance with paragraph 4, first subparagraph, to be present at the<br>control operations referred to in the second indent of that subparagraph shall advise the<br>requested authority accordingly in good time before the start of those operations.</p>
<p>The officials of the requested authority shall at all times be in charge of carrying out<br>control operations.</p>
<p>The officials of the applicant authority shall:</p>
<p>- produce written authorization specifying their identity and status,</p>
<p>- have, within the limits impcsed by the Contracting Party of the requested authority</p>
<p>on its own officials in carrying out the Controls concerned:</p>
<p>285</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>« the rights of access provided for in Article 3(3),</p>
<p>« the right to be informed of the results of Controls carried out by the officials of the<br>requested authority pursuant to Article 3(3),</p>
<p>- adopt, in the course of Controls, an attitude compatible with the rules and practices<br>which must be followed by officials of the Contracting Party within the territory of<br>which the control operations are carried out.</p>
<p>6. The reasoned requests referred to in this Article shall be forwarded to the requested<br>authority of the Contracting Party in question via the liaison authority of that Contracting<br>Party. The same shall apply for:</p>
<p>- the answers to those requests, and</p>
<p>- Communications conceming the application of paragraphs 2, 4 and 5.</p>
<p>By way of derogation from the first subparagraph and in the interests of quicker and<br>more effective co-operation between them, a Contracting Party may, in certain<br>appropriate cases, permit a competent authority to:</p>
<p>- make its reasoned request or communication directly to a competent authority of<br>another Contracting Party;</p>
<p>- reply directly to reasoned requests or Communications received from a competent<br>authority of another Contracting Party.</p>
<p>286</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203<br>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>Article 6</p>
<p>Urgent notification</p>
<p>Where a competent authority of a Contracting Party has grounds for suspicion or learns:</p>
<p>that a product referred to in this Protocol does not comply with the rules conceming<br>trade in wine or has been the subject of fraudulent action to obtain or market such a<br>product, and</p>
<p>that such failure to comply with the rules is of specific interest to one or more other<br>Contracting Parties and is such as to lead to administrative measures or legal action,</p>
<p>that competent authority shall, via the liaison authority under which it comes, notify the<br>liaison authority of the Contracting Party concerned without delay.</p>
<p>Article 7</p>
<p>Form and substance of requests for assistance</p>
<p>1. &nbsp;Requests pursuant to this Appendix shall be made in writing. Documents necessary for<br>the execution of such requests shall accompany the request. When required because of<br>the urgency of the situation, oral requests may be accepted but must be confirmed in<br>writing immediately.</p>
<p>2. &nbsp;Requests pursuant to paragraph 1 shall include the following information:</p>
<p>- the name of the applicant authority making the request;</p>
<p>- the measure requested;</p>
<p>287</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>- the object of, and the reason for, the request;</p>
<p>- laws, rules, and other legal instruments involved;</p>
<p>- indications as exact and comprehensive as possible on the natural or legal persons<br>being the target of the investigations;</p>
<p>- a summary of the relevant facts.</p>
<p>3. &nbsp;Requests shall be submitted in an official language of the requested authority or in a<br>language acceptable to such authority.</p>
<p>4. &nbsp;If a request does not meet the formal requirements, its correction or completion may be<br>demanded; the ordering of precautionary measures may, however, take place.</p>
<p>Article 8</p>
<p>Form in which information is to be communicated</p>
<p>1. &nbsp;The requested authority shall communicate results of enquiries to the applicant authority<br>in the form of documents, certified copies of documents, reports and the like.</p>
<p>2. &nbsp;The documents provided for in paragraph 1 may be replaced by computerized<br>information produced in any form for the same purpose.</p>
<p>288</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>Article 9</p>
<p>Exceptions to the obligation to provide assistance</p>
<p>1. &nbsp;The Contracting Party or the requested authority may refuse to give assistance as<br>provided for in this Appendix, where to do so would:</p>
<p>- &nbsp;be likely to prejudice sovereignty, public policy (l'ordre public), security or other<br>essential interests; or</p>
<p>- involve currency or tax regulations.</p>
<p>2. &nbsp;Where the applicant authority asks for assistance which it would itself be unable to<br>provide if so asked, it shall draw attention to the fact in its request. It shall then be left<br>to the requested authority to decide how to respond to such a request.</p>
<p>3. &nbsp;If assistance is withheld or denied, the decision and the reasons therefor must be<br>notified to the applicant authority without delay.</p>
<p>Article 10</p>
<p>Common provisions</p>
<p>1. The information referred to in Article 5 and Article 6 shall be accompanied by documents<br>or other evidence and details of any administrative measures or legal action and shall<br>reläte in particular to:</p>
<p>- composition and organoleptic characteristics;</p>
<p>- description and presentation;</p>
<p>289</p>
<p>19 Riksdagen 1993/94. 1 saml. Nr 203. Bilagor</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>- compliance with the rules laid down for preparation and marketing of the product in<br>question.</p>
<p>2. &nbsp;The liaison authorities concerned by a case for which the mutual assistance procedure<br>referred to in Artides 5 and 6 is initiated shall inform each other without delay of:</p>
<p>- the progress of investigations, particularly in the form of reports and other documents<br>or information media, and</p>
<p>- any administrative or legal action taken subsequent to the operations concerned.</p>
<p>3. &nbsp;Travel costs incurred in the application of this Appendix shall be borne by the<br>Contracting Party which has appointed an official for the measures referred to in<br>Article 5(2) and (4).</p>
<p>4. &nbsp;This Article shall not prejudice national provisions conceming the secrecy of legal<br>proceedings.</p>
<p>Title IV</p>
<p>General provisions</p>
<p>Article 11</p>
<p>Collection of samples</p>
<p>1. In the context of the application of Titles II and III, the competent authority of a<br>Contracting Party may request the competent authority of another Contracting Party to<br>collect samples in accordance with the relevant provisions in that Contracting Party.</p>
<p>290</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>2. &nbsp;The requested authority shall hold the samples collected pursuant to paragraph 1 and<br>shall determine, inter alia, the laboratory to which they are to be submitted for<br>examination. The applicant authority may designate another laboratory to analyse<br>parallel samples. For this purpose, the requested authority shall forward an appropriate<br>number of samples to the applicant authority.</p>
<p>3. &nbsp;In the case of disagreement between the applicant authority and the requested authority<br>with regard to the results of the examination referred to in paragraph 2, an arbitration<br>analysis shall be carried out by a mutually designated laboratory.</p>
<p>Article 12</p>
<p>Obligation to observe confidentiality</p>
<p>1. &nbsp;Any information communicated in whatever form pursuant to this Appendix shall be of a<br>confidential nature. It shall be covered by the obligation of official secrecy and shall<br>enjoy the protection extended under the relevant laws applicable in the Contracting Party<br>which received it or the corresponding provisions applying to the Community authorities,<br>as the case may be.</p>
<p>2. &nbsp;This Appendix shall not oblige a Contracting Party whose legislation or administrative<br>practices impose stricter limits for the protection of industrial and commercial secrecy<br>than those laid down in this Appendix to supply information, where the applicant<br>Contracting Party does not take steps to comply with these stricter limits.</p>
<p>291</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203<br>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>Article 13</p>
<p>Use of information</p>
<p>1. &nbsp;Information obtained shall be used solely for the purposes of this Appendix and may be<br>used within each Contracting Party for other purposes only with the prior written<br>consent of the administrative authority which furnished the information and shall be<br>subject to any restrictions laid down by that authority.</p>
<p>2. &nbsp;&nbsp;Paragraph 1 shall not impede the use of information in any judicial or administrative<br>proceedings subsequently instituted for offence under ordinary criminal law, provided<br>that it has been obtained in the framework of an international legal assistance procedure.</p>
<p>3. &nbsp;The Contracting Parties may, in their records of evidence, reports and testimonies and in<br>proceedings and charges brought before the courts, use as evidence information<br>obtained and documents consulted in accordance with the provisions of this Appendix.</p>
<p>Article 14</p>
<p>Information obtained pursuant to this Appendix - conclusive force</p>
<p>The findings of the specific officials of the competent authorities of a Contracting Party in the<br>course of application of this Appendix may be invoked by the competent authorities of the<br>other Contracting Parties. In such cases, they shall have no less value because of the fact<br>that they do not come from the Contracting Party in question.</p>
<p>292</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203<br>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>Article 15</p>
<p>Persons subject to Controls</p>
<p>Natural or legal persons and groups of such persons whose activities may be the subject of<br>the Controls referred to in this Appendix shall not obstruct such Controls and shall be required<br>to facilitate them at all times.</p>
<p>Article 16</p>
<p>Implementation</p>
<p>1. &nbsp;The Contracting Parties shall transmit to each other:</p>
<p>- lists of the liaison authorities designated to act as correspondents for the purpose of<br>the operational implementation of this Appendix;</p>
<p>- lists of laboratories authorized to carry out analyses pursuant to Article 11(2).</p>
<p>2. &nbsp;The Contracting Parties shall consult each other and subsequently keep each other<br>informed of the detailed rules of implementation which are adopted in accordance with<br>the provisions of this Appendix. In particular, they shall transmit to each other national<br>provisions and a summary of administrative and judicial decisions of particular relevance<br>to the correct application of the rules conceming trade in wine.</p>
<p>293</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>Article 17</p>
<p>Complementarity</p>
<p>This Appendix shall complement and not impede application of any agreements on mutual<br>assistance which have been concluded or may be concluded between two or more<br>Contracting Parties. Nor shall it preclude more extensive mutual assistance granted under<br>such agreements.&quot;.</p>
<p>294</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>Annex 2</p>
<p>to Decision No 7/94<br>of the EEA Joint Committee</p>
<p>ANNEX I (VETERINARY AND PHYTOSANITARY MATTERS) to the EEA Agreement shall be<br>amended as specified below.</p>
<p>A. Chapter I. VETERINARY ISSUES</p>
<p>I. In the introductory part</p>
<p>1. Paragraph 4 shall be replaced by:</p>
<p>&quot;4. The acts referred to in this Chapter. except Directives 91/67/EEC, 91/492/EEC,<br>91/493/EEC, 92/48/EEC, 93/53/EEC and 93/54/EEC, as well as</p>
<p>Decisions 91/654/EEC, 92/92/EEC, 92/528/EEC, 92/532/EEC, 92/538/EEC,<br>93/22/EEC, 93/25/EEC, 93/39/EEC, 93/40/EEC, 93/44/EEC, 93/51/EEC,<br>93/55/EEC, 93/56/EEC, 93/57/EEC, 93/58/EEC, 93/59/EEC, 93/73/EEC,<br>93/74/EEC, 93/75/EEC, 93/76/EEC, 93/169/EEC, 93/383/EEC and 93/351/EEC,<br>do not apply to Iceland.</p>
<p>However, Directive 90/667/EEC and Decision 92/562/EEC shall apply to Iceland as<br>regards the disposal and Processing of fish-waste, its placing on the market and<br>the prevention of pathogens in feedstuffs of fish origin. Furthermore, in<br>Directive 92/118/EEC the provisions of Annex I, Chapter 6(I)(A) second indent<br>shall apply to Iceland.</p>
<p>The other Contracting Parties may maintain their third-country regime in trade with<br>Iceland for areas not covered by the acts and provisions mentioned. The<br>Contracting Parties shall review the matter during 1995.”.</p>
<p>295</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>2. &nbsp;&nbsp;Paragraph 11 shall be replaced by:</p>
<p>&quot;11. Designation of common reference laboratories and co-ordinating institutes.</p>
<p>Without prejudice to financial implications, the Community reference<br>laboratories and the Community co-ordinating institutes shall act as reference<br>laboratories and co-ordinating institutes for all Parties to this Agreement.</p>
<p>Consultations shall take place between the Contracting Parties in order to define<br>the working conditions.'.</p>
<p>3. &nbsp;&nbsp;The following new paragraph shall be inserted after paragraph 11:</p>
<p>&quot;1 la. Designation of common reserves of foot-and-mouth disease vaccines.</p>
<p>Without prejudice to financial implications, the Community reserves of<br>foot-and-mouth disease vaccines shall act as reserves of foot-and-mouth disease<br>vaccines for all Parties to this Agreement.</p>
<p>Consultations shall take place between the Contracting Parties in order to</p>
<p>- organize transition from national reserves to Community reserves;</p>
<p>- solve all the problems conceming in particular working conditions, financial<br>matters, replacement of antigen, possible use of antigens and on-the-spot<br>inspections.&quot;.</p>
<p>4. &nbsp;&nbsp;The following new paragraph shall be inserted after paragraph 12:</p>
<p>&quot;13. Council Directive 92/65/EEC of 13 July 1992 laying down animal health<br>requirements governing trade in and imports into the Community of animals,<br>semen, ova and embryos not subject to animal health requirements laid down in<br>specific Community rules referred to in Annex A(l) to Directive 90/425/EEC<br>(OJ No L 268, 14.9.1992, p. 54), Council Directive 92/102/EEC of<br>27 November 1992 on the identification and registration of animals<br>(OJ No L 355, 5.12.1992, p. 32) and Commission Decision 93/317/EEC of<br>21 April 1993 conceming the content of the code to be used on bovine ear<br>marks (OJ No L 122, 18.5.1993, p. 45) have not been integrated into this<br>Agreement. The Contracting Parties shall review this matter in 1995.&quot;.</p>
<p>296</p>

<p>&quot;African horse sickness</p>
<p>14a. 392 L 0035: Council Directive 92/35/EEC of 29 April 1992 laying down control<br>rules and measures to combat African horse sickness (OJ No L 157, 10.6.1992,<br>p. 19).</p>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the present Agreement,<br>be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>300</p>

<p>Newcastle disease</p>
<p>14c. 392 L 0066: Council Directive 92/66/EEC of 14 July 1992 introducing<br>Community measures for the control of Newcastle disease (OJ No L 260,</p>
<p>5.9.1992, p. 1).</p>
<p>The provisions of this Directive shall, for the purposes of the present Agreement,<br>be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) Article 2 (e) shall be replaced by:</p>

<p>34b. 392 L 0118: Council Directive 92/118/EEC of 17 December 1992 laying down<br>animal health and public health requirements governing trade in and imports into<br>the Community of products not subject to the said requirements laid down in<br>specific Community rules referred to in Annex A (I) to Directive 89/662/EEC and,<br>as regards pathogens, to Directive 90/425/EEC (OJ No L 62, 15.3.1993, p. 49).</p>

<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>This Directive shall be without prejudice to the adoption of more detailed<br>rules on animal health in the framework of the specific rules in other acts<br>referred to in Annex I Chapter I to the EEA Agreement, nor the maintenance<br>of restrictions on trade of products covered by the specific rules in other<br>acts referred to in Annex I Chapter I to the EEA Agreement based on public<br>health.&quot;</p>
<p>The Contracting Parties shall review this adaptation in 1995.</p>
<p>(b) Article 2(1 )(a) shall be replaced by:</p>
<p>”Trade&quot; means, without prejudice to the provision in paragraph 1 (a) second<br>indent of the introductory part of Chapter I of Annex I to the EEA<br>Agreement, trade between the Contracting Parties of the products of animal<br>origin mentioned in Article 1;&quot;.</p>
<p>(c) Article 2(2) shall be replaced by:</p>
<p>&quot;For the purposes of this Directive the following definitions shall apply as<br>necessary:</p>
<p>&quot;veterinary check&quot; shall mean any physical check and/or administrative<br>formality which applies to the products referred to in Article 1 and<br>which is intended for the protection, direct or indirect, of public or<br>animal health;</p>
<p>&quot;establishment&quot; shall mean any undertaking which produces, stores or<br>processes the products referred to in Article 1;</p>
<p>&quot;competent authority&quot; shall mean the central authority of a<br>Contracting Party competent to carry out veterinary checks or any<br>authority to which it has delegated that competence;</p>
<p>&quot;official veterinarian&quot; shall mean the veterinarian appointed by the<br>competent authority;</p>
<p>316</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>‘holding&quot; shall mean an agricultural establishment or premises of a<br>dealer, as defined by the national rules in force, situated in the territory<br>of a Contracting Party and in which animals, with the exception of<br>equidae, are held or regularly kept, and the holding as defined in<br>Article 2(a) of Council Directive 90/426/EEC of 26 June 1990 on<br>animal health conditions governing the movement and import from<br>third countries of live equidae (see Annex I, Chapter I point 3 of the<br>EEA Agreement);</p>
<p>&quot;centre or organization&quot; shall mean any undertaking which produces,<br>stores, processes or handles the products referred to in Article 1.&quot;</p>
<p>(d) Article 7(1), (2) and (3) shall not apply.</p>
<p>(e) For the purpose of the decisions to be taken by the EFTA Surveillance<br>Authority under this Directive, the procedure referred to in Article 18 shall<br>apply.</p>
<p>(f) In Article 20(1) the date &quot;1 January 1994&quot; shall be read &quot;1 July 1995&quot;.</p>
<p>(g) Article 20(3) shall not apply.</p>
<p>(h) In Annex I Chapter 6(I)(C) the last subparagraph shall be replaced by:</p>
<p>&quot;Trade in meat meal and bone meal remains subject to the rules laid down by<br>the Contracting Party of destination&quot;.</p>
<p>(i) &nbsp;Annex I Chapter 9 shall not apply.</p>
<p>(j) &nbsp;Annex I Chapter 11 shall not apply.</p>
<p>(k) Annex I Chapter 12 shall not apply.</p>
<p>317</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203<br>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>(l) &nbsp;&nbsp;For the application of Annex I, Chapter 14 the following shall apply:</p>
<p>Unprocessed manure from poultry flocks vaccinated against Newcastle<br>disease shall not be sent to a region which has obtained the non-vaccination<br>status in accordance with the provisions of Article 1 2(2) of Council<br>Directive 90/539/EEC.</p>
<p>(m) &nbsp;Annex II, Chapter 1 shall not apply.</p>
<p>Zoonoses</p>
<p>34c. 392 L 0117: Council Directive 92/117/EEC of 17 December 1992 conceming<br>measures for protection against specified zoonoses and specified zoonotic agents<br>in animals and products of animal origin in order to prevent outbreaks of<br>food-borne infections and intoxications (OJ No L 62, 15.3.1993, p. 38).</p>
<p>The provisions of this Directive shall, for the purposes of the present Agreement,<br>be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) In Article 10(1) first subparagraph, the date '1 January 1994’ shall, with<br>regard to Finland, read ’1 January 1995&quot;.</p>
<p>(b) In Article 17(1), the date ’1 January 1994’ shall, with regard to Norway,<br>read &quot; 1 July 1995&quot;.&quot;.</p>

<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>Annex 3</p>
<p>to Decision No 7/94<br>of the EEA Joint Committee</p>
<p>ANNEX II (TECHNICAL REGULATIONS, STANDARDS, TESTING AND CERTIFICATION) to the<br>EEA Agreement shall be amended as specified below.</p>
<p>A. Chapter I. MOTOR VEHICLES</p>
<p>1. In the adaptation to Chapter I, the following shall be inserted as a new second<br>paragraph:</p>
<p>&quot;For the purpose of this Agreement and to ensure free circulation according to the<br>&quot;Community acquis&quot; from 1 January 1995, the provisions of Article 3 of</p>
<p>Directives 91/441/EEC, 91/542/EEC, 92/97/EEC and 93/59/EEC shall be applied by the<br>EFTA States in the following way:</p>
<p>When making provisions for tax incentives, the EFTA States shall ensure that these<br>incentives will not distort competition in the EEA. Such incentives must, in particular,<br>meet the following conditions:</p>
<p>they must not hinder free circulation;</p>
<p>they must apply to all vehicles which are offered for sale on the market of an<br>EFTA State:</p>
<p>they shall not apply to vehicles fulfilling mandatory standards;<br>they shall not, by their amount or scope of application, constitute a<br>trade-distorting subsidy.</p>
<p>The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall be informed in due time of any plans to<br>introduce or amend tax incentives.</p>
<p>The EC Commission and the EFTA Surveillance Authority shall exchange information<br>they have received from the EC Member States or from EFTA States.'.</p>
<p>2a. The following indents shall be added in point 1 (Council Directive 70/156/EEC) before<br>the adaptation:</p>
<p>340</p>

<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>The Contracting Parties agree on the objective that the provisions of the<br>Community acts on dangerous substances and preparations should apply by<br>1 January 1995. Finland shall comply with the provisions of the acts as from<br>the entry into force of the seventh amendment to Council<br>Directive 67/548/EEC. Pursuant to co-operation to be initiated from the<br>signature of this Agreement in order to solve remaining problems, a review of<br>the situation will take place during 1 994, including matters not covered by<br>Community legislation. If an EFTA State concludes that it will need any<br>derogation from the Community acts relating to classification and labelling, the<br>latter shall not apply to it unless the EEA Joint Committee agrees on another<br>solution.</p>
<p>As regards the exchange of information, the following shall apply:</p>
<p>(i) &nbsp;&nbsp;The EFTA States that comply with the acquis on dangerous substances<br>and preparations shall give equivalent guarantees to those existing within<br>the Community that:</p>
<p>- where information is treated as confidential on the grounds of industrial<br>and commercial secrecy within the Community, according to the<br>provisions of the Directive, only those EFTA States which have taken<br>over the relevant acquis shall participate in the exchange of<br>information,</p>
<p>- confidential information will be afforded the same degree of protection<br>in the EFTA States as that which obtains within the Community;</p>
<p>(ii) &nbsp;&nbsp;All EFTA States will participate in the exchange of informat,on conceming<br>all other aspects as provided for in the Directive.'.</p>
<p>8. The following new points shall be inserted after point 15 (C/146/90/p. 4):</p>
<p>&quot;16. C/1 /93/p. 3: The European Chemical Bureau. Commission communication to the<br>Council and the European Parliament<br>(OJ No C 1,5.1.1993, p. 3).</p>
<p>17. C/130/93/p. 1: Communication - Third publication of Elincs</p>
<p>(OJ No C 130, 10.5.1993, p. 1).</p>

<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>With regard to the sulphur content of diesel fuels:</p>
<p>- Austria and Finland may maintain their national legislation until 1 C 'ober 1996;</p>
<p>- Iceland may maintain its national legislation until 1 October 1999. ne<br>Contracting Parties shall review the situation before the transitional period<br>expires.</p>
<p>With regard to the sulphur content of gas fuels other than, or used for purposes<br>other than, diesel fuels, with the exception of aviation kerosene, Austria and<br>Finland may maintain their national legislation until 1 October 1999. However,<br>new EC rules will be dealt with according to the procedures laid down in<br>Artides 97 to 104 of the Agreement.'.</p>

<p>'ACTS OF WHICH THE CONTRACTING PARTIES SHALL TAKE NOTE</p>
<p>The Contracting Parties take note of the content of the following acts:</p>
<p>2. &nbsp;C/44/92/p. 13: Commission Communication in the framework of the<br>implementation of the &quot;New Approach&quot; Directives, &quot;Personal Protective<br>Equipment&quot; Council Directive 89/686/EEC of 21 December 1989</p>
<p>(OJ No C 44, 19.2.1992, p. 1 3).</p>
<p>3. &nbsp;C/240/92/p. 6: Commission Communication in the framework of the<br>implementation of Council Directive 89/686/EEC in relation to personal protective<br>equipment</p>
<p>(OJ Nr C 240, 19.9.1992, p. 6).</p>
<p>4. &nbsp;C/345/93/p. 8: Commission Communication in the framework of the<br>implementation of Council Directive 89/686/EEC of 21 December 1989 in relation<br>to personal protective equipment, as amended by the Council</p>
<p>Directives 93/68/EEC and 93/95/EEC</p>
<p>(OJ No C 345, 23.12.1993, p. 8).&quot;.</p>

<p>S. &nbsp;CHAPTER XXV. TOBACCO</p>
<p>1. The following shall be added in point 1 (Council Directive 89/622/EEC):</p>
<p>as amended by:</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;392 L 0041: Council Directive 92/41/EEC of 15 May 1992</p>
<p>(OJ No L 158, 1 1.6.1992, p. 30).</p>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the present Agreement, be<br>read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) The prohibition in Article 8 of Directive 89/622/EEC as amended by<br>Directive 92/41/EEC shall not apply to the placing on the market in Iceland,<br>Norway and Sweden of the product defined in Article 2.4 of<br>Directive 89/622/EEC, as amended by Directive 92/41/EEC. However, this<br>derogation shall not apply to the prohibition of sales of &quot;snus&quot; in forms resembling<br>food products. Furthermore, Iceland, Norway and Sweden shall apply an export<br>ban on the product defined in Article 2.4 of Directive 89/622/EEC, as amended by<br>Directive 92/41/EEC, to all other Contracting Parties to the present Agreement.</p>
<p>(b) Products existing on 1 January 1994, which do not comply with the requirements<br>of Directive 89/622/EEC, as amended by Directive 92/41/EEC, may still be<br>marketed in Austria until 30 June 1994.&quot;.</p>

<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>Annex 5</p>
<p>to Decision No 7/94<br>of the EEA Joint Committee</p>
<p>Annex V (FREE MOVEMENT OF WORKERS) to the EEA Agreement shall be amended as<br>specified below:</p>
<p>1. &nbsp;The following indent shall be added to point 2 (Council Regulation (EEC) No 1612/68)<br>before the adaptation:</p>
<p>- 392 R 2434: Council Regulation (EEC) No 2434/92 of 27 July 1992 (OJ No L 245,</p>
<p>26.8.1992, p. 1).</p>
<p>2. &nbsp;The text of adaptation (a) in point 2 (Council Regulation (EEC) No 1612/68) shall be<br>deleted.</p>
<p>3. &nbsp;The following point shall be inserted after point 6 (Council Directive 77/468/EEC):</p>
<p>&quot;7. 393 D 0569: Commission Decision 93/569 of 22 October 1993 on the</p>
<p>implementing of Council Regulation (EEC) No 1612/68 on freedom of movement of<br>workers within the Community as regards, in particular, a network entitled Eures<br>(European Employment Services) (OJ No L 274, 6.11.1993, p. 32).'</p>
<p>The provisions of the Decision shall, for the purposes of the present Agreement, be read<br>with the following adaptation:</p>
<p>in Annex I, point 2.2.1 Definition, the expression &quot;non-Member States' shall not apply to<br>the EFTA Contracting Parties (Austria, Finland, Iceland, Norway and Sweden).</p>

<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>Annex 7</p>
<p>to Decision No 7/94<br>of the EEA Joint Committee</p>
<p>ANNEX VII (MUTUAL RECOGNITION OF PROFESSIONAL QUALIFICATIONS) to the EEA<br>Agreement shall be amended as specified below.</p>
<p>A. General system</p>
<p>1. The following new point shall be inserted after point 1 (Council Directive 89/48/EEC):</p>
<p>&quot;1a. &nbsp;&nbsp;392 L 0051: Council Directive 92/51 /EEC of 18 June 1992 on a second</p>
<p>general system for the recognition of professional education and training to<br>supplement Directive 89/48/EEC (OJ No L 209, 24.7.1992, p. 25).</p>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the present<br>Agreement, be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) Amendments to Annexes C and D according to Article 15 of the Directive<br>shall be carried out according to the following procedures:</p>
<p>I. Amendments conceming courses of education and training provided in<br>an EC Member State</p>
<p>1. Where the reasoned request is submitted by an EC Member State:</p>
<p>a) EFTA experts shall participate in the Community internal<br>decision-making procedure provided for in Article 15 of the<br>Directive in accordance with Article 100 of the Agreement.</p>
<p>b) The Community decision shall be transmitted to the EEA</p>
<p>Joint Committee in accordance with Article 102 of the<br>Agreement.</p>
<p>408</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>2. Where the reasoned request is submitted by an EFTA State:</p>
<p>a) The EFTA State shall submit a request for amendment to the<br>EEA Joint Committee.</p>
<p>b) The EEA Joint Committee shall transmit the request to the<br>Commission.</p>
<p>c) The Commission shall refer the request to the committee<br>provided for in Article 15 of the Directive; EFTA experts shall<br>participate in accordance with Article 100 of the Agreement.</p>
<p>d) The Community decision shall be transmitted to the EEA Joint<br>Committee in accordance with Article 102 of the Agreement.</p>
<p>II. Amendments conceming courses of eduction and training provided in<br>an EFTA State:</p>
<p>1. Where the reasoned request is submitted by an EFTA State:</p>
<p>a) The EFTA State shall submit a request for amendment to the<br>EEA Joint Committee.</p>
<p>b) The EEA Joint Committee shall transmit the request via the<br>competent sub-committee to a wc «ung group, composed, for<br>the EC side, of the members of the EC Committee established<br>under Article 15 of the Directive and, for the EFTA side, of<br>experts from the EFTA States.</p>
<p>c) The EEA Joint Committee shall take its decision on an<br>amendment of Annexes C and D on the basis of the report<br>submitted by the working group referred to in b).</p>
<p>2. Where the reasoned request is submitted by an EC Member State:</p>
<p>a) The EC Member State shall submit its request to the<br>Commission.</p>
<p>b) The Commission shall transmit the request to the EEA Joint<br>Committee.</p>
<p>c) The EEA Joint Committee shall follow the procedure laid down<br>in 1 .b) and c).</p>
<p>409</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203<br>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>(b) The following shall be added to Annex C:</p>
<p>LIST OF COURSES HAVING A SPECIAL STRUCTURE AS REFERRED TO<br>IN POINT (ii) OF THE SECOND INDENT OF THE FIRST SUBPARAGRAPH<br>OF ARTICLE 1(a)</p>
<p>(a) Under the heading &quot;1. Paramedical and childcare training courses&quot;<br>the following shall be inserted:</p>
<p>in Austria</p>
<p>training for</p>
<p>— &nbsp;contact lens optician (Kontaktlinsenoptiker&quot;)</p>
<p>— &nbsp;pedicurist (&quot;Fusspfleger&quot;)</p>
<p>-— acoustic-aid technician (&quot;Hörgeräteakustiker&quot;)</p>
<p>— &nbsp;druggist (&quot;Drogist&quot;)<br></p>
<p>which represent education and training courses of a total duration<br>of at least fourteen years, including at least five years' training<br>followed within a structured training framework, divided into an<br>apprenticeship of at least three years' duration, comprising training<br>partly received in the workplace and partly provided by a vocational<br>training establishment, and a period of professional practice and<br>training, culminating in a professional examination conferring the<br>rights to exercise the profession and to train apprentices.</p>
<p>training for</p>
<p>— masseur (&quot;Masseur&quot;)</p>
<p>which represents education and training courses of a total duration<br>of fourteen years, including five years' training within a structured<br>training framework, comprising an apprenticeship of two years<br>duration, a period of professional practice and training of two years'<br>duration and a training course of one year culminating in a<br>professional examination conferring the rights to exercise the<br>profession and to train apprentices</p>
<p>410</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203<br>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>— kindergarten worker (&quot;Kindergärtner/in&quot;)</p>
<p>— child care worker (&quot;Erzieher&quot;)</p>
<p>which represent education and training courses of a total duration<br>of thirteen years, including five years of professional training in a<br>specialized school, culminating in an examination.&quot;</p>
<p>(b) Under the heading &quot;2. Master craftsman sector<br>(&quot;Mester/Meister/MaTtre&quot;) which represents education and training<br>courses conceming skills not covered by the Directives listed in<br>Annex A&quot; the following shall be inserted:</p>

<p>— gardener (&quot;Gärtner&quot;)</p>
<p>which represent education and training of a total duration of at<br>least fourteen years, including at least five years' training within a<br>structured training framework, divided into an apprenticeship of at<br>least three years' duration, comprising training received partly in<br>the workplace and partly provided by a vocational training<br>establishment, and a period of professional practice and training of<br>at least two years' duration culminating in a mastership<br>examination conferring the rights to exercise the profession, to<br>train apprentices and to use the title &quot;Meister&quot;.</p>

<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>training for master craftsmen in the field of agriculture and<br>forestry, namely,</p>
<p>— master in agriculture (&quot;Meister in der Landwirtschaft&quot;)</p>
<p>— master in rural home economics (&quot;Meister in der ländlichen<br>Hauswirtschaft&quot;)</p>
<p>— master in horticulture (&quot;Meister im Gartenbau&quot;)</p>
<p>— master in market gardening (&quot;Meister im Feldgemusebau&quot;)</p>
<p>— master in pomology and fruit-processing (&quot;Meister im Obstbau<br>und in der Obstverwertung&quot;)</p>
<p>— master in viniculture and wine-production (&quot;Meister im<br>Weinbau und in der Kellerwirtschaft&quot;)</p>
<p>— master in dairy farming (&quot;Meister in der Molkerei und<br>Käsereiwirtschaft&quot;)</p>
<p>— master in horse husbandry (&quot;Meister in der Pferdewirtschaft&quot;)</p>
<p>— master in fishery (&quot;Meister in der Fischereiwirtschaft&quot;)</p>
<p>— master in poultry farming (&quot;Meister in der Geflugelwirtschaft&quot;)</p>
<p>— master in apiculture (&quot;Meister in der Bienen wirtschaft&quot;)</p>

<p>— master in forestry plantation and forest management (&quot;Meister<br>in der Forstgarten- und Forstpflegewirtschaft&quot;)</p>
<p>— master in agricultural warehousing (&quot;Meister in der<br>landwirtschaftlichen Lagerhaltung&quot;)</p>
<p>These courses are of a total duration of at least fifteen years<br>including at least six years' training followed within a structured<br>training framework divided into an apprenticeship of at least three<br>years' duration, comprising training partly received in the business<br>and partly provided by a vocational training establishment, and a<br>period of three years of professional practice culminating in a<br>mastership examination which confers the rights to train<br>apprentices and to use the title &quot;Meister&quot;.</p>

<p>training for:</p>
<p>--- landscape gardener (&quot;anleggsgartner&quot;)</p>
<p>--- dental technician (&quot;tanntekniker&quot;)</p>
<p>These courses are of a total duration of at least fourteen years,<br>including at least five years training within a structured training<br>framework divided into an apprenticeship of at least three years'<br>duration, comprising training partly received in the workplace and<br>partly provided by a vocational training establishment, and a<br>period of professional practice and training of two years' duration,<br>culminating in a mastership examination relating to the craft and<br>conferring the rights to train apprentices and to use the title<br>&quot;Mester&quot;.&quot;</p>
<p>(c) &quot;Under the heading &quot;3. Seafaring sector&quot; the following shall be<br>inserted:</p>

<p>— marine engineer, first grade (&quot;yélstjdri 1. stigs&quot;)</p>
<p>413</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>In Norway</p>
<p>training for</p>
<p>— master mariner/deck officer Class 1 (&quot;skipsferer&quot;)</p>
<p>— chief mate/deck officer Class 2 (&quot;overstyrmann&quot;)</p>
<p>--- master home trade/deck officer Class 3 (&quot;kystskipper&quot;)</p>
<p>--- mate/watchkeeping officer/deck officer Class 4 (&quot;styrmann&quot;)</p>
<p>— chief engineer officer/engineer officer Class 1 (&quot;maskinsjef”)</p>
<p>— second engineer officer/engineer officer Class 2 (&quot;1. maskinist”)</p>
<p>— solo engineer/engineer officer Class 3 (&quot;enemaskinist”)</p>
<p>— watchkeeping engineer/engineer officer Class 4<br>(&quot;maskinoffiser”)</p>
<p>which represents training</p>
<p>--- in Iceland, of nine or ten years' primary schooling followed by<br>two years' service at sea, supplemented by three years of<br>specialized vocational training (five years for the marine<br>engineer)</p>
<p>— in Norway, of nine years' primary schooling followed by a<br>course of basic training and service at sea of three years (two<br>and a half years for engineering officers), supplemented by</p>
<p>— for watchkeeping officers, one year of specialized vocational<br>training,</p>
<p>— for the others, two years of specialized vocational training</p>
<p>and by further service at sea and which is recognized under the<br>International STCW Convention (International Convention on<br>Standards of Training, Certification and Watchkeeping for<br>Seafarers, 1978).</p>
<p>414</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>In Norway</p>
<p>training for</p>
<p>— electro-automation officer (ship's<br>electrician)(&quot;elektroautomasjonstekniker/skipselektriker&quot;)</p>
<p>which represents training of nine years' primary schooling followed<br>by a two year course of basic training, supplemented by one year<br>of practical experience and service at sea and one year of<br>specialized vocational training.&quot;</p>
<p>(ii) Under the sub-heading &quot;(b) Sea fishing&quot;:</p>
<p>&quot;In Iceland</p>

<p>-- ship's captain (&quot;skipstjöri&quot;)</p>
<p>— chief mate (&quot;styrimaöur&quot;)</p>

<p>which represents training of nine or ten years' primary<br>schooling followed by two years' service at sea,<br>supplemented by two years of specialized vocational training<br>culminating in an examination and is recognized under the<br>Torremolinos Convention (1977 International Convention for<br>the Safety of Fishing Vessels).’</p>

<p>— control room operator (&quot;kontrollromoperater&quot;)</p>
<p>— technical section leader (&quot;teknisk sjef&quot;)</p>
<p>— assistant technical section leader (&quot;teknisk assistent&quot;)</p>
<p>which represents training of nine years' primary schooling,<br>followed by a two year course of basic training, supplemented by<br>at least one year's service off-shore and,</p>
<p>— for the control room operator, one year of specialized<br>vocational training</p>
<p>— for the others, two and a half years of specialized vocational<br>training.&quot;</p>
<p>(d) Under the heading &quot;4. Technical sector&quot; the following shall be<br>inserted:</p>
<p>&quot;In Austria</p>
<p>training for</p>
<p>— &nbsp;forester (&quot;Förster&quot;) ,</p>
<p>— &nbsp;technical Consulting (&quot;Technisches Buro&quot;)</p>
<p>— &nbsp;labour leasing (&quot;Uberlassung von Arbeitskräften -</p>
<p>Arbeitsleihe&quot;)</p>
<p>— &nbsp;employment agent (&quot;Arbeitsvermittlung&quot;)</p>
<p>— &nbsp;investment adviser (&quot;Vermögensberater&quot;)</p>
<p>private investigator (&quot;Berufsdetektiv&quot;)</p>
<p>— &nbsp;security guard (&quot;Bewachungsgewerbe&quot;)</p>
<p>— &nbsp;real estate agent (&quot;Immobilienmakler&quot;)</p>

<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>which represents education and training of a total duration of at<br>least fifteen years, comprising eight years' compulsory schooling<br>followed by five years' secondary technical or commercial study,<br>culminating in a technical or commercial mature level qualifying<br>examination, supplemented by at least two years' workplace<br>education and training culminating in a professional examination.</p>
<p>— &nbsp;insurance consultant (&quot;Berater in<br>Versicherungsangelegenheiten&quot;)</p>
<p>which represents an education and training course of a total<br>duration of 15 years and includes six years' training followed<br>within a structured training framework, divided into an<br>apprenticeship of three years' duration and a three year period of<br>professional practice and training, culminating in an examination.</p>
<p>— &nbsp;master builder/planning and technical calculation (&quot;Planender<br>Baumeister&quot;)</p>
<p>— &nbsp;master woodbuilder/planning and technical calculation<br>(&quot;Planender Zimmermeister&quot;)</p>
<p>which represents education and training of a total duration of at<br>least eighteen years, including at least nine years' vocational<br>training divided into four years' of secondary technical study and<br>five years' of professional practice and training culminating in a<br>professional examination conferring the rights to exercise the<br>profession and to train apprentices, insofar as this training relätes<br>to the right to plan buildings, to make technical calculations and to<br>supervise construction work (&quot;the Maria Theresian<br>privilege&quot;) I<sup>1</sup>)&quot;.</p>

<p>420</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>(a) &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;in Article 48, the words &quot;notification of this Directive&quot; shall read<br>&quot;decision by the EEA Joint Committee to include this Directive in the<br>EEA Agreement&quot;;</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;this Directive shall not apply to Finland.&quot;.</p>
<p>4. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The following indent shall be added in point 11 (First Council Directive 79/267/EEC)<br>before the adaptations:</p>

<p>9.12.1992, p. 1).’.</p>
<p>5. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In point 11 (First Council Directive 79/267/EEC), adaptation (a) shall be replaced by<br>the following:</p>
<p>&quot;(a) The following shall be added to Article 4:</p>
<p>This Directive shall not concern the pension activities of pension insurance<br>undertakings prescribed in the Employees' Pensions Act (TEL) and other related<br>Finnish legislation provided that:</p>
<p>1. &nbsp;&nbsp;pension insurance companies which already under Finnish law are obliged to<br>have separate accounting and management systems for their pension activities<br>will furthermore, as from the date of entry into force of the decision by the EEA<br>Joint Committee to include the third life assurance Directive 92/96/EEC in the<br>EEA Agreement, set up separate legal entities for carrying out these activities;</p>
<p>2. &nbsp;&nbsp;the Finnish authorities allow in a non-discriminatory manner all nationals and<br>companies of Contracting Parties to perform according to Finnish legislation the<br>activities specified in Article 1 related to this exemption whether by means of:</p>
<p>ownership or participation in an existing insurance company or group;<br>creation or participation of new insurance companies or groups,<br>including pension insurance companies;</p>
<p>421</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>3. the Finnish authorities submit for the approval of the EEA Joint Committee a<br>report before the date of entry into force of the decision by the EEA Joint<br>Committee to include the third life assurance Directive 92/96/EEC in the EEA<br>Agreement, stating which measures have been taken to split up TEL activities<br>from normal insurance activities carried out by Finnish insurance companies in<br>order to conform to all the requirements of the third life assurance Directive.</p>
<p>It is understood that the Finnish authorities in accordance with the relevant<br>provisions of the First Council Directive 79/267/EEC shall withdraw the authorization<br>for insurance companies which have not carried out the provisions of paragraph 1<br>above by the date of entry into force of the decision by the EEA Joint Committee to<br>include the third life assurance Directive 92/96/EEC in the EEA Agreement.&quot;.</p>

<p>&quot;, as amended by</p>
<p>392 L 0096: Council Directive 92/96/EEC of 10 November 1992 (OJ No L 360,</p>
<p>9.12.1992, p. 1).&quot;.</p>

<p>90/619/EEC):</p>
<p>&quot;12a. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;392 L 0096: Council Directive 92/96/EEC of 10 November 1992 on the</p>
<p>co-ordination of laws, regulations and administrative provisions relating<br>to direct life assurance and amending Directives 79/267/EEC and<br>90/619/EEC (third life assurance Directive) (OJ No L 360, 9.12.1992,<br>p. 1).</p>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the present<br>Agreement, be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) Article 2: see adaptation (a) to Council Directive 79/267/EEC;</p>
<p>422</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>(b) &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1. Sweden shall adopt the laws, regulations and administrative</p>
<p>provisions necessary for it to comply with Article 22(1 )(b) of this<br>Directive by 1 January 2000.</p>
<p>2. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;By 1 July 1994, the Swedish authorities shall submit for the<br>approval of the EEA Joint Committee a schedule of the measures<br>to be adopted to have the exposures exceeding the limits of<br>Article 22(1 )(b) of this Directive brought within the said limits.</p>
<p>3. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Not later than 31 December 1997 the Swedish authorities shall<br>present a progress report to the EEA Joint Committee on the<br>measures taken to comply with this Directive.</p>
<p>4. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The EEA Joint Committee shall review the measures on the basis<br>of the reports described in paragraphs 2 and 3. In the light of<br>developments, these measures shall, if appropriate, be adapted<br>with a view to accelerating the process of reduction of the<br>exposures.</p>
<p>5. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Swedish authorities shall require the life assurance<br>companies concerned to initiate immediately the process of<br>reduction of the relevant exposures. The companies concerned<br>will at no time increase these exposures, unless they are already<br>within the limits prescribed by the Directive and any such<br>increase does not lead them to exceed those limits.</p>
<p>6. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Swedish authorities shall submit by the end of the<br>transitional period a final report on the results of the above<br>measures;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;in Article 45, the words &quot;the date of notification of this Directive&quot; shall<br>read &quot;the date of the Decision by the EEA Joint Committee to include<br>this Directive in the EEA Agreement&quot;.&quot;.</p>
<p>423</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>

<p>(b) &nbsp;&nbsp;Norway and Sweden may apply their national accounting standards and the<br>scope of consolidation until the end of the transition periods granted to them in<br>the adaptation to Council Directive 86/635/EEC on the annual accounts and<br>Consolidated accounts of banks and other financial institutions.'.</p>
