<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the present Agreement, be<br>read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;&nbsp;Austria, Norway and Sweden shall implement the provisions of the Directive by<br>1 January 1995;</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;&nbsp;loans secured to the satisfaction of the competent authorities by shares in<br>Finnish residential housing companies, operating in accordance with the Finnish<br>Housing Company Act 1991 or subsequent equivalent legislation, shall be<br>treated in the same way as the ones secured by mortgages on residential<br>property in accordance with the rules set out in Article 4(7)(p) and 6(9) of the<br>Directive;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;&nbsp;in Article 6(1), the words &quot;when this Directive is published in the Official<br>Journal of the European Communities&quot; shall read &quot;on the date of publication in<br>the Official Journal of the European Communities of the Decision by the EEA<br>Joint Committee to include this Directive in the EEA Agreement&quot;;</p>
<p>(d) &nbsp;&nbsp;in Article 6(3), the words &quot;on the date of the publication of this Directive in the<br>Official Journal of the European Communities’ shall read &quot;on the date of<br>publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities of the Decision<br>by the EEA Joint Committee to include this Directive in the EEA Agreement”.&quot;.</p>
<p>C. Chapter III. STOCK EXCHANGE AND SECURITIES</p>
<p>1. The following new heading and new points shall be inserted after point 30 (Council<br>Directive 85/611/EEC):</p>
<p>&quot;(iii) Investment services</p>
<p>30a. 393 L 0006: Council Directive 93/6/EEC of 15 March 1993 on the Capital<br>adequacy of investment firms and credit institutions (OJ No L 141, 1 1.6.1 993,<br>p. 1).</p>
<p>426</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the present<br>Agreement, be read with the following adaptation:</p>
<p>in Article 3(5), the words &quot;the date of notification of this Directive&quot; shall read<br>“the date of entry into force of the decision by the EEA Joint Committee to<br>include this Directive in the EEA Agreement&quot;.</p>
<p>30b. 393 L 0022: Council Directive 93/22/EEC of 10 May 1993 on investment<br>services in the securities field (OJ No L 141, 11.6.1993, p. 27).</p>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the present<br>Agreement, be read with the following adaptation:</p>
<p>as regards relations with third-country investment firms described in Article 7<br>of the Directive, the following shall apply:</p>
<p>1. with a view to achieving a maximum degree of convergence in the<br>application of a third-country regime for investment firms, the contracting<br>Parties shall exchange information as described in Artides 7(2) and 7(6) and<br>consultations shall be held regarding matters referred to in Artides 7(3),<br>7(4) and 7(5), within the framework of the EEA Joint Committee and<br>according to specific procedures to be agreed by the contracting Parties;</p>
<p>2. authorizations granted by the competent authorities of a contracting party<br>to investment firms being direct or indirect subsidiaries of parent<br>undertakings governed by the laws of a third country shall have validity in<br>accordance with the provisions of this directive throughout the territory of<br>all contracting Parties. However,</p>
<p>(a) when a third country imposes quantitative restrictions on the<br>establishment of investment firms of an EFTA State or imposes<br>restrictions on such investment firms that it does not impose on<br>Community investment firms, authorizations granted by competent<br>authorities within the Community to investment firms being direct or<br>indirect subsidiaries of parent undertakings governed by the laws of that<br>third country shall have validity only in the Community, except where<br>an EFTA State decides otherwise for its own jurisdiction;</p>
<p>427</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>(b) &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;where the Community has decided that decisions regarding authorizations of<br>investment firms being direct or indirect subsidiaries of parent undertakings<br>governed by the laws of a third country shall be limited or suspended, any<br>authorization granted by a competent authority of an EFTA State to such<br>investment firms shall have validity only in its own jurisdiction, except where<br>another contracting Party decides otherwise for its own jurisdiction;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the limitations or suspensions referred to in subparagraphs (a) and (b) may not<br>apply to investment firms or their subsidiaries already authorized in the territory<br>of a Contracting Party;</p>
<p>3. whenever the Community negotiates with a third country on the basis of Artides 7(4)<br>and 7(5), in order to obtain national treatment and effective market access for its<br>investment firms, it shall endeavour to obtain equal treatment for the investment firms<br>of the EFTA States.&quot;.</p>

<p>insurance intermediaries (OJ No L 19, 28.1.1 992, p. 32).&quot;.</p>

<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>Annex 11<br>to Decision No 7/94<br>of the EEA Joint Committee</p>
<p>Annex XIII (TRANSPORT) to the EEA Agreement shall be amended as specified below.</p>
<p>A. CHAPTER I. INLAND TRANSPORT</p>
<p>1. &nbsp;&nbsp;The following indent shall be added in point 11 (Council Regulation (EEC) No 1107/70)<br>before the adaptation:</p>
<p>392 R 3578: Council Regulation (EEC) No 3578/92 of 7 December 1992<br>(OJ No L 364, 12.12.1992, p.1 1).&quot;.</p>
<p>2. &nbsp;&nbsp;The following shall be added in point 12 (Council Regulation (EEC) No 4060/89) before<br>the adaptation:</p>
<p>', as amended by:</p>
<p>391 R 3356: Council Regulation (EEC) No 3356/91 of 7 November 1991<br>(OJ No L 318, 20.11.1991, p. 1).&quot;.</p>

<p>&quot;The EFTA States to which this Directive applies shall continue to apply<br>their existing provisions referred to in Article 3(1) so as to ensure that<br>competition is not distorted, i.e. that the rate for each vehicle category or<br>subcategory referred to in the Annex is not lower than the minimum laid<br>down in that Annex.</p>
<p>Without prejudice to Article 6 of Council Directive 92/106/EEC of<br>7 December 1992, the EFTA States to which this present Directive<br>applies may not grant any exemption from, or reduction in, the taxes<br>referred to in Article 3 which would distort competition, i.e. which would<br>render the chargeable tax lower than the minimum referred to in the<br>previous paragraph.&quot;;</p>
<p>(e) &nbsp;&nbsp;the following shall be added at the end of the first subparagraph of<br>Article 7(d):</p>

<p>434</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>The provisions of the Regulation shall, for the purposes of the present<br>Agreement, be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;&nbsp;this Regulation shall not apply to undertakings established in Austria, nor<br>shall it apply m connection with international carriage of goods to, through<br>and from Austria to that part of any journey carried out in the Austrian<br>territory. For mutual rights of market access, bilateral agreements<br>between Austria and the other Contracting Parties shall apply;</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;&nbsp;conditions for international carriage of goods to, through and from<br>Austrian territory by hauliers established in the European Community are<br>determined by the Agreement between the European Economic<br>Community and the Republic of Austria on the transit of goods by road<br>and rail, signed in Oporto on 2 May 1992, which entered into force on</p>
<p>1 January 1993.</p>
<p>For that part of any journey carried out in the Austrian territory, conditions<br>for international carriage of goods to, through and from Austrian territory<br>by hauliers established in Iceland, Finland, Norway and Sweden are<br>determined by the administrative agreements/exchanges of<br>letters/protocols concluded by the Contracting Parties concerned on<br>23 November 1993 (Iceland-Austria), on 24 February/2 March 1993<br>(Finland-Austria), on 1 February 1994 (Norway-Austria), and on</p>
<p>17 February 1994 (Sweden-Austria).</p>
<p>If the Contracting Parties to the above administrative<br>agreements/exchanges of letters/protocols or to the Transit Agreement<br>intend to review or consensua'!v ’erminate their respective agreements,<br>they shall notify the EEA Joint jmmittee thereof 6 months before the<br>entry into force of the agreed measures. Subsequently, consultations<br>shall take place in the EEA Joint Committee on any proposed amendment<br>or consensual termination.</p>
<p>If any of the Contracting Parties considers that the abovementioned<br>amendment or termination of the agreement concerned creates an<br>imbalance between the rights and obligations of the Contracting Parties<br>under the EEA Agreement, the EEA Joint Committee shall endeavour to<br>find a mutually acceptable solution.</p>
<p>435</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>Any consultation and consideration according to the two preceding<br>paragraphs shall be strictly limited to those parts of the above<br>administrative agreements/exchanges of letters/protocols or the<br>Transit Agreement, which are to be amended or consensually terminated.</p>
<p>If no solution can be found within six months, Article 114 of the<br>Agreement shall apply mutatis mutandis.</p>
<p>The prevalence of the provisions of the Transit Agreement ove<sup>f</sup> the<br>EEA Agreement to the extent that they cover the same subject matter<br>according to Protocol 43 to this Agreement is not affected by the four<br>preceding paragraphs;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;&nbsp;Article 1(2) shall be replaced by the following:</p>
<p>&quot;In the event of carriage from a Contracting Party to a third country c<br>Austria and vice versa, this Regulation shall not apply to that part of any<br>journey carried out within the territory of the Contracting Party of loading<br>or unloading, unless otherwise agreed by the Contracting Parties.';</p>
<p>(d) &nbsp;&nbsp;Article 1(3) shall be replaced by the following:</p>
<p>&quot;This Regulation shall not affect provisions relating to the carriage referred<br>to in paragraph 2 laid down in bilateral agreements concluded between<br>Contracting Parties which either under bilateral authorizations or under<br>liberalization agreements allow loading and unloading in a Contracting<br>Party by hauliers established in another Contracting Party.&quot;;</p>
<p>(e) &nbsp;&nbsp;the EFTA States shall recognize the Community authorizations issued by<br>the EC Member States in accordance with the Regulation. For the<br>purposes of such recognition, in the General Provisions of the Community<br>authorization set out in Annex I of the Regulation, references to<br>&quot;Community&quot; shall be read &quot;Community and Finland, Iceland, Norway and<br>Sweden&quot; and references to &quot;Member State(s)' shall be read</p>
<p>&quot;EC Member State(s) and (or) Finland, Iceland, Norway and Sweden.&quot;;</p>
<p>(f) &nbsp;&nbsp;the Community and the EC Member States shall recognize the<br>authorizations issued by Finland, Iceland, Norway and Sweden in<br>accordance with the Regulation, as adapted in Appendix 1 to this Annex;</p>
<p>(g) &nbsp;&nbsp;when issued by Finland, Iceland, Norway and Sweden, the authorizations<br>shall correspond to the model set out in Appendix 1 to this Annex.&quot;.</p>
<p>436</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>26b. 390 R 3916: Council Regulation (EEC) No 3916/90 of 21 December 1990 on<br>measures to be taken in the -vent of a crisis in the market in the carriage of<br>goods by road</p>
<p>(OJ No L 375, 31.12.1990 p. 10).</p>
<p>The provisions of the Regulation shall, for the purposes of the present<br>Agreement, be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;&nbsp;this Regulation shall not apply to Austria;</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;&nbsp;in the cases referred to in Article 3, regarding the EFTA States,<br>&quot;Commission&quot; shall read &quot;EFTA Surveillance Authority&quot;;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;&nbsp;in situations referred to in Article 4:</p>
<p>regarding the EFTA States, &quot;Commission&quot; shall read &quot;EFTA<br>Surveillance Authority&quot; and &quot;Council&quot; shall read &quot;EFTA Standing<br>Committee&quot;;</p>
<p>if the EC Commission receives a request from an EC Member State<br>or the EFTA Surveillance Authority from an EFTA State to adopt<br>safeguard measures, the EEA Joint Committee shall without delay<br>be notified thereof and be provided with all relevant information.</p>
<p>At the request of a Contracting Party, consultations shall take place<br>with:- the EEA Joint Committee. Such consultations may also be<br>requested in the case of prolongation of the safeguard measures.</p>
<p>Once the EC Commission or the EFTA Surveillance Authority has adopted<br>a decision, it shall immediately notify the measures taken to the EEA Joint<br>Committee.</p>
<p>If any of the Contracting Parties considers that the safeguard measures<br>would create an imbalance between the rights and obligations of the<br>Contracting Parties, Article 114 of the Agreement shall apply<br>mutatis mutandis;</p>
<p>(d) &nbsp;&nbsp;with regard to Article 5, the EFTA States shall be associated with the<br>work of the Advisory Committee as regards its general tasks of following<br>the situation on the transport market and giving advice as to the collection<br>of the data necessary to monitor the market and detect a crisis.</p>

<p>(f) &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;in situations referred to in Article 7:</p>
<p>- regarding the EFTA States, &quot;Commission&quot; shall read &quot;EFTA<br>Surveillance Authority&quot; and &quot;Council&quot; shall read &quot;EFTA Standing<br>Committee&quot;;</p>
<p>- if the Commission receives a request from an EC Member State or the<br>EFTA Surveillance Authority from Iceland, Norway, Finland or Sweden<br>to adopt safeguard measures, the EEA Joint Committee shall without<br>delay be notified thereof and be provided with all relevant information.</p>
<p>At the request of a Contracting Party, consultations shall take place<br>within the EEA Joint Committee. Such consultations may also be<br>requested in the case of prolongation of the safeguard measures.</p>
<p>Once the EC Commission or the EFTA Surveillance Authority has adopted<br>a decision, it shall immediately notify the measures taken to the EEA Joint<br>Committee.</p>
<p>If any of the Contracting Parties concerned considers that the safeguard<br>measures would create an imbalance between the rights and obligations<br>of the Contracting Parties, Article 114 of the Agreement shall apply<br>mutatis mutandis;</p>
<p>(g) &nbsp;the Agreement between Denmark, Finland, Norway and Sweden on<br>cabotage transport of goods by road, which entered into force on</p>
<p>11 April 1993, shall, on the date of entry into force of the EEA Joint<br>Committee decision to include this Regulation in the EEA Agreement, be<br>superseded by the provisions of this Regulation;</p>
<p>(h) &nbsp;&nbsp;Iceland, Norway, Finland and Sweden shall recognize the Community<br>documents issued by the Commission and the EC Member States in<br>accordance with Annexes I to III to the Regulation as sufficient proof to<br>carry out national cabotage operations in Iceland, Norway, Finland or<br>Sweden. For the purposes of such recognition, in the provisions of the<br>Community documents set out in Annexes I, II, III and IV to the<br>Regulation, references to &quot;Member State(s)' shall read</p>
<p>&quot;EC Member State(s), Iceland, Norway, Finland and/or Sweden&quot;;</p>
<p>440</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>(i) &nbsp;&nbsp;the Community and the EC Member States shall recognize the documents<br>issued by Iceland, Norway, Finland and Sweden in accordance with<br>Annexes I to III to the Regulation, as adapted in Appendix 2 to this Annex<br>as sufficient proof to carry out national cabotage operations in an</p>
<p>EC Member State;</p>
<p>(j) &nbsp;&nbsp;when issued by Iceland, Norway, Finland and Sweden, the documents in<br>Annexes I to IV to the Regulation shall correspond to the models set out<br>in Appendix 2 to this Annex.”.</p>
<p>11. &nbsp;Point 32 (Council Regulation (EEC) No 516/72) shall be replaced by the following:</p>
<p>”32. 392 R 0684: Council Regulation (EEC) No 684/92 of 16 March 1992 on common<br>rules for the international carriage of passengers by coach and bus<br>(OJ No L 74, 20.3.1992, p. 1).</p>
<p>The provisions of the Regulation shall, for the purposes of the present Agreement,<br>be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;&nbsp;Article 1(2) shall be replaced by the following:</p>
<p>&quot;In the event of carriage from a Contracting Party to a third country and<br>vice versa, this Regulation shall not apply to that part of any journey carried<br>out within the territory of the Contracting Party of picking up or setting<br>down, unless otherwise agreed by the Contracting Parties.&quot;;</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;&nbsp;Article 1(3) shall not apply.”.</p>
<p>12. &nbsp;Point 33 (Council Regulation (EEC) No 517/72) shall be replaced by the following:</p>
<p>”33. 392 R 1839: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 1839/92 of 1 July 1992 laying<br>down detailed rules for the application of Council Regulation No 684/92 as regards<br>documents for the international carriage of passengers<br>(OJ No L 187, 7.7.1992, p. 5), as amended by:</p>
<p>- 393 R 2944: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 2944/93 of 25 October 1993<br>(OJ No L 266, 27.10.1993, p. 2).</p>
<p>441</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>The provisions of the Regulation shall, for the purposes of the present Agreement,<br>be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;the EFTA States shall recognize the Community documents issued by the<br>EC Member States in accordance with the Regulation. For the purposes of<br>such recognition, in the provisions of the Community documents set out in<br>Annexes I, IA, III, IV and V to the Regulation, references to</p>
<p>&quot;Member State(s)&quot; shall be read &quot;EC Member State(s), Iceland, Norway,<br>Austria, Finland or Sweden&quot;, and, in the titles of documents set out in<br>Annexes IA, III, IV and V, references to &quot;Member States’ shall be read<br>&quot;States that are either EC Member States or EFTA States&quot;;&quot;</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;the Community and the EC Member States shall recognize the documents<br>issued by Iceland, Norway, Austria, Finland and Sweden in accordance with<br>the Regulation and the adaptations set out in, or referred to in, paragraph (c);</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;&nbsp;Iceland, Norway, Austria, Finland and Sweden shall issue documents<br>corresponding to:</p>
<p>- Annex I to the Regulation. In that Annex, the reference to</p>
<p>&quot;EC Member State&quot; shall be replaced by &quot;EC Member State, Iceland,<br>Norway, Austria, Finland or Sweden&quot;;</p>
<p>- the other Annexes to the Regulation which shall be issued in accordance<br>with the model set out in Appendix 3 to this Annex.'.</p>
<p>13. The following new point shall be inserted after point 33 (Commission Regulation (EEC)<br>No 1839/92):</p>
<p>&quot;33a. &nbsp;392 R 2454: Council Regulation (EEC) No 2454/92 of 23 July 1992 laying</p>
<p>down the conditions under which non-resident carriers may operate national<br>road passenger transport services within a Member State<br>(OJ No L 251,29.8.1992, p. 1).</p>
<p>The provisions of the Regulation shall, for the purposes of the present<br>Agreement, be read with the following adaptations :</p>
<p>(a) the text of Article 4(1 )(e) shall be replaced by the following:</p>
<p>&quot;VAT (value added tax) or turnover tax on transport services&quot;;</p>
<p>442</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>(b) &nbsp;&nbsp;in situations referred to in Article 8:</p>
<p>- regarding the EFTA States, 'Commission&quot; shall read &quot;EFTA<br>Surveillance Authority&quot; and &quot;Council&quot; shall read &quot;EFTA Standing<br>Committee&quot;;</p>
<p>- if the EC Commission receives a request from an EC Member State or<br>the EFTA Surveillance Authority from an EFTA State to adopt<br>safeguard measures, the EEA Joint Committee shall without delay be<br>notified thereof and be provided with all relevant information.</p>
<p>At the request of a Contracting Party, consultations shall take place within<br>the EEA Joint Committee. Such consultations may also be requested in<br>the case of prolongation of the safeguard measures.</p>
<p>Once the EC Commission or the EFTA Surveillance Authority has adopted<br>a decision, it shall immediately notify the measures taken to the EEA Joint<br>Committee.</p>
<p>If any of the Contracting Parties considers that the safeguard measures<br>would create an imbalance between the rights and obligations of the<br>Contracting Parties, Article 114 of the Agreement shall apply mutatis<br>mutandis;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;the EFTA States shall recognize the Community documents issued by the<br>EC Member States in accordance with the Regulation. For the purposes<br>of such recognition, in the provisions of the Community documents set<br>out in Annexes I, II and III to the Regulation, references to</p>
<p>&quot;Member State(s)” shall read &quot;EC Member State(s), Iceland, Norway,<br>Austria, Finland and/or Sweden&quot;;</p>

<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<h3>ANNEX I</h3>
<p>(a)</p>
<p>(Blue card - DIN A4)</p>
<p>(First page of the authorization)<br></p>
<p>(Text in (one of) the official language(s) of the EFTA State issuing the authorization)</p>
<p>State issuing the &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Name of the competent</p>
<p>authorization &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;authority or body</p>
<p>Distinguishing sign l<sup>1</sup>)</p>
<p>AUTHORIZATION No ...</p>
<p>for the international carriage of goods by road for hire or reward</p>
<p>This authorization entitles</p><img src="https://data.riksdagen.se/fil/GH03203/prop_199394__203-13.png" style="width:165pt;height:13pt;"/>
<p>to engage in the international carriage of goods by road for hire or reward by any route, for<br>journeys or parts of journeys effected for hire or reward within the territory of the<br>European Community and Finland, Iceland, Norway and Sweden (<sup>3</sup>) as laid down in<br>Council Regulation (EEC) No 881/92 of 26 March 1992 as adapted for the purposes of the<br>Agreement on the European Economic Area (EEA Agreement), and subject to the general<br>provisions of this authorization.</p>
<p>Particular remarks:</p>
<p>This authorization shall be valid from ........to........</p>
<p>Issued in................................... on............................................... (<sup>4</sup>)</p>
<p>f<sup>1</sup>) The distinguishing signs are: IS (Iceland), N (Norway), FIN (Finland), S (Sweden).</p>
<p>(<sup>2</sup>) &nbsp;&nbsp;Name or business name and full address of the haulier.</p>
<p>(<sup>3</sup>) &nbsp;&nbsp;Hereinafter referred to as the &quot;Reference States&quot;; Regulation No 881/92 as adapted for the purposes of the<br>EEA Agreement sball not apply in connection with international carriage of goods to, through and from<br>Austria to that part of any joumey carried out in tbe Austrian territory. For mutual rights of market access<br>in all these cases bilateral agreements between Austria and the European Community or the Reference States<br>shall apply.</p>
<p>(<sup>4</sup>) &nbsp;&nbsp;Signature and stamp of the issuing competent authority or body.</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>(b)</p>
<p>(Second page of the authorization)</p>
<p>This authorization is issued under Council Regulation (EEC) No 881/92 of 26 March 1992 as<br>adapted for the purposes of the EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>It entitles the holder to engage in the international carriage of goods by road for hire or<br>reward by any route for journeys or parts of journeys effected within the territories of the<br>European Community and the Reference States and, when appropriate, subject to the<br>conditions laid down herein:</p>
<p>- where the point of departure and the point of arrival are situated in two different States<br>which are either EC Member States or Reference States, with or without transit through<br>one or more EC Member States or Reference States or third countries;</p>
<p>- from an EC Member State or a Reference State to a third country or vice versa, with or<br>without transit through one or more EC Member States or Reference States or third<br>countries;</p>
<p>- between third countries with transit through the territory of one or more</p>
<p>EC Member States or Reference States,</p>
<p>and unladen journeys in connection with such carriage.</p>
<p>In the case of carriage from an EC Member State or Reference State to a third country or<br>Austria or vice-versa, this authorization is not valid for that part of the journey effected in the<br>EC Member State or Reference State of loading or unloading.</p>
<p>The authorization is personal to the holder and is not transferable.</p>
<p>It may be withdrawn by the competent authority of the Reference State which issued it,<br>notably where the haulier has:</p>
<p>- not complied with all the conditions for using the authorization;</p>
<p>- supplied incorrect information with regard to the data needed for the issue or extension of<br>the authorization.</p>
<p>454</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>The original of the authorization must be kept by the haulage undertaking.</p>
<p>A certified copy of the authorization must be kept in the vehicle. I<sup>1</sup>'</p>
<p>In the case of a coupled combination of vehicles it must accompar . the motor vehicle. It<br>covers the coupled combination of vehicles even if the trailer or semi-trailer is not registered<br>or authorized to use the roads in the name of the authorization holder or if it is registered or<br>authorized to use the roads in an EC Member State or another Reference State.</p>
<p>The authorization must be produced whenever required by an authorized inspecting officer.</p>
<p>Within the territory of each EC Member State and Reference State the holder must comply<br>with the laws, regulations and administrative provisions in force in that State, in particular<br>with regard to transport and traffic.</p>
<p>I<sup>1</sup>) &quot;Vehicle” means a motor vehicle registered in a Reference State or a coupled<br>combination of vehicles, the motor vehicle of which at least is registered in a Reference<br>State, used exclusively for the carriage of goods.</p>
<p>455</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<h3>APPENDIX 2</h3>
<p>DOCUMENTS SET OUT IN THE ANNEXES TO<br>COUNCIL REGULATION (EEC) No 3118/93,</p>
<p>AS ADAPTED FOR THE PURPOSES OF THE EEA AGREEMENT</p>
<p>(SEE ADAPTATION (j) IN POINT 26c OF ANNEX XIII TO THE AGREEMENT)</p>
<p>456</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>ANNEX I</p>
<p>(a)</p>
<p>(Thick green paper • format DIN A4)</p>
<p>(First page of cabotage authorization)</p>
<p>(Deadlines of periods of validity)</p>
<p>[Text to be worded in the official language or languages of the State issuing the authorization; translations in<br>Icelandic, Norwegian, Finnish and Swedish respectively and</p>
<p>in the official languages of the EC Member States to be given on pages (f), (g) and (h)]</p>
<p>COMMISSION<br>OF THE<br>EUROPEAN<br>COMMUNITIES</p>
<p>(Impressed<br>stamp of the<br>Commission<br>of the European<br>Communities)</p>
<p>State issuing<br>the authorization/</p>
<p>international</p>
<p>Competent<br>authority<br>or agency</p>
<p>distinguishing</p>
<p>sign (<sup>1</sup>)</p>
<p>CABOTAGE AUTHORIZATION No ......</p>
<p>for the national carriage of goods by road in a Member State<br>of the European Community or in Iceland, Norway,<br>Finland or Sweden performed by a non-resident carrier<br>(cabotage)</p>
<p>This authorization entitles (<sup>2</sup>).............................</p>
<p>to carry goods by road by means of a motor vehicle or a coupled combination of vehicles, within a Member State<br>of the European Community or within a Reference State other than that in which the holder of this authorization is<br>established, and to move such vehicle or combination unladen over any part of the territories of the aforesaid EC<br>or Reference States.</p>
<p>This authorization is valid for a period of two months</p>
<p>from .................................................... to .............</p>
<p>issued at............................................... date..........</p>
<p>(3)</p>
<p>(<sup>1</sup>) &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;International distinguishing signs are: Iceland (IS), Norway (N), Finland (FIN), Sweden (S).</p>
<p><sup>n</sup> &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;EC Member States are: Belgium, Denmark, Germany, Greece, Spain, France, Ireland, Italy, Luxembourg,</p>
<p>Netherlands, Portugal and United Kingdom.</p>
<p>Hereinafter referred to as the &quot;Reference States&quot;; Regulation (EEC) 3118/93 as adapted for the purposes of<br>the EEA Agreement shall not apply to undertakings established in Austria nor to the Austrian territory. For<br>mutual rights of market access in this case, bilateral agreements between Austria and the European<br>Community or the Reference States shall apply.</p>
<p>(<sup>2</sup>) &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Name, or registered business name, and full address of carrier.</p>
<p><sup>(3)</sup> &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Signature and stamp of the competent authority or agency issuing the authorization.</p>
<p>457</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>(b)</p>
<p>(Second page of cabotage authorization)</p>
<p>[Text to be worded in the official language or languages of the Reference State issuing the<br>authorization; translations in the official languages of the other Reference States and the EC<br>Member States to be given on pages (c), (d) and (e)]</p>
<p>General provisions</p>
<p>This authorization permits the national carriage of goods by road in any EC Member State or<br>Reference State other than that in which the holder of the authorization is established<br>(cabotage).</p>
<p>It is personal to the holder and non-transferable.</p>
<p>It may be withdrawn by the competent authority of the Reference State which issued it or,<br>where the authorization is a forgery, by the EC Member State or Reference State in which the<br>cabotage transport operations are carried out.</p>
<p>It may be used for only one vehicle at a time. Vehicle means a motor vehicle registered in the<br>Reference State of establishment or a coupled combination of vehicles of which at least the<br>motor vehicle is registered in the Reference State of establishment and which are used<br>exclusively for the carriage of goods.</p>
<p>In the case of a coupled combination of vehicles, it shall accompany the motor vehicle.</p>
<p>It must be carried in the vehicle and must be accompanied by a book of record sheets for all<br>national cabotage operations effected under it.</p>
<p>The cabotage authorization and the book of record sheets must be filled in before the<br>cabotage operations begin.</p>
<p>The authorization and the book of record sheets for national cabotage operations must be<br>produced together whenever required by an authorized inspecting officer.</p>
<p>Save as otherwise provided in Community regulations, as adapted for the purposes of the<br>Agreement on the European Economic Area, the performance of cabotage transport<br>operations shall be subject to the laws, regulations and administrative provisions in force in<br>the host EC Member State or Reference State in the following areas:</p>
<p>458</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>(a) &nbsp;&nbsp;rates and conditions governing the transport contract;</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;weights and dimensions of road vehicles; such weights and dimensions may, where<br>appropriate, exceed those applicable in the carrier's Reference State of establishment,<br>but they may under no circumstances exceed the technical standards set out in the<br>certificate of conformity;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;&nbsp;requirements relating to the carriage of certain categories of goods, in particular<br>dangerous goods, perishable foodstuffs, live animals;</p>
<p>(d) &nbsp;&nbsp;driving and rest time;</p>
<p>(e) &nbsp;&nbsp;VAT or turnover tax on transport services.</p>
<p>The technical standards of construction and equipment which vehicles used to carry out<br>cabotage transport operations must meet shall be those laid down for vehicles put into<br>circulation in international transport.</p>
<p>This authorization must be returned to the competent issuing authority or agency within eight<br>days following its date of expiry.</p>
<p>(c), (d) and (e)</p>
<p>(Third, fourth and fifth pages of Reference States' cabotage<br>authorization)</p>
<p>[Translations in the official languages of the other<br>Reference States and the EC Member States of the text on<br>page (b)]</p>
<p>(f), (g) and (h)</p>
<p>(Sixth, seventh and eighth pages of the cabotage<br>authorization)</p>
<p>[Translations in the official languages of the other<br>Reference States and the EC Member States of the text on<br>page (a)]</p>
<p>459</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>

<p>[Text to be worded in the official language or languages of<br>the State issuing the authorization; translations in<br>Icelandic, Norwegian, Finnish and Swedish respectively and<br>in the official languages of the EC Member States to be<br>given on pages (f), (g) and (h)]</p>
<p>COMMISSION<br>OF THE</p>
<p>EUROPEAN</p>
<p>COMMUNITIES</p>
<p>(Impressed<br>stamp of the<br>Commission<br>of the European<br>Communities)</p>
<p>State issuing</p>
<p>the authorization/</p>
<p>international<br>distinguishing</p><img src="https://data.riksdagen.se/fil/GH03203/prop_199394__203-14.png" style="width:12pt;height:6pt;"/>

<p>CABOTAGE AUTHORIZATION No<br></p>
<p>for the national carriage of goods by road in a Member State<br>of the European Community <sup>,</sup>’<sup>1</sup> or in Iceland, Norway,<br>Finland or Sweden<sup>&lt;</sup>**<sup>)</sup> performed by a non-resident carrier<br>(cabotage)</p>

<p>to carry goods by road by means of a motor vehicle or a coupled combination of vehicles, within a Member State<br>of the European Community or within a Reference State other than that in which the holder of this authorization is<br>established, and to move such vehicle or combination unladen over any part of the territories of the aforesaid EC<br>or Reference States.</p>
<p>This authorization is valid for a period of one month</p>
<p>from ................................................... to .................................................</p>
<p>issued at.............................................. date ..............................................</p>
<p>(3)</p>

<p>EC Member States are: Belgium, Denmark, Germany, Greece, Spain, France, Ireland, Italy, Luxembourg,<br>Netherlands, Portugal and United Kingdom.</p>
<p>Hereinafter referred to as the &quot;Reference States&quot;; Regulation (EEC) 3118/93 as adapted for the purposes of<br>the EEA Agreement shall not apply to undertakings established in Austria nor to the Austrian territory. For<br>mutual rights of market access in this case, bilateral agreements between Austria and the European<br>Community or the Reference States shall apply.</p>
<p><sup>(2)</sup> Name, or registered business name, and full address of carrier.</p>

<p>460</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>(b)</p>
<p>(Second page of cabotage authorization)</p>
<p>[Text to be worded in the official language or languages of the Reference State issuing the<br>authorization; translation in the official languages of the other Reference States and the EC<br>Member States to be given on pages (c), (d) and (e))</p>
<p>General provisions</p>
<p>This authorization permits the national carriage of goods by road in any EC Member State or<br>Reference State other than that in which the holder of the authorization is established<br>(cabotage).</p>
<p>It is personal to the holder and non-transferable.</p>
<p>It may be withdrawn by the competent authority of the Reference State which issued it or,<br>where the authorization is a forgery, by the EC Member State or Reference State in which the<br>cabotage transport operations are carried out.</p>
<p>It may be used for only one vehicle at a time. Vehicle means a motor vehicle registered in the<br>Reference State of establishment or a coupled combination of vehicles of which at least the<br>motor vehicle is registered in the Reference State of establishment and which are used<br>exclusively for the carriage of goods.</p>
<p>In the case of a coupled combination of vehicles, it shall accompany the motor vehicle.</p>
<p>It must be carried in the vehicle and must be accompanied by a book of record sheets for all<br>national cabotage operations effected under it.</p>
<p>The cabotage authorization and the book of record sheets must be filled in before the<br>cabotage operations begin.</p>
<p>The authorization and the book of record sheets for national cabotage operations must be<br>produced together whenever required by an authorized inspecting officer.</p>
<p>Save as otherwise provided in Community regulations, as adapted for the purposes of the<br>Agreement on the European Economic Area, the performance of cabotage transport<br>operations shall be subject to the laws, regulations and administrative provisions in force in<br>the host EC Member State or Reference State in the following areas:</p>
<p>461</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>(a) &nbsp;&nbsp;rates and conditions governing the transport contract;</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;weights and dimensions of road vehicles; such weights and dimensions may, where<br>appropriate, exceed those applicable in the carrier's Reference State of establishment,<br>but they may under no circumstances exceed the technical standards set out in the<br>certificate of conformity;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;&nbsp;requirements relating to the carriage of certain categories of goods, in particular<br>dangerous goods, perishable foodstuffs, live animals;</p>
<p>(d) &nbsp;&nbsp;driving and rest time;</p>
<p>(e) &nbsp;&nbsp;VAT or turnover tax on transport services.</p>
<p>The technical standards of construction and equipment which vehicles used to carry out<br>cabotage transport operations must meet shall be those laid down for vehicles put into<br>circulation in international transport.</p>
<p>This authorization must be returned to the competent issuing authority or agency within eight<br>days following its date of expiry.</p>
<p>(c), (d) and (e)</p>
<p>(Third, fourth and fifth pages of Reference States' cabotage<br>authorization)</p>

<p>[Translations in the official languages of the other<br>Reference States and the EC Member States of the text on<br>page (a)J</p>

<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<h3>ANNEX III</h3>
<p>(a)</p>
<p>(Format DIN A4)</p>
<p>(Front cover of book of record sheets)</p>
<p>(Text in the official language or languages of the Reference<br>State issuing the book of record sheets - translations in<br>the official languages of the other Reference States to be<br>given overleaf, and in the official languages of the EC<br>Member States to be given on page (d))</p>
<p>State issuing the book of record sheets &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Competent authr or agency</p>
<p>International distinguishing</p>
<p>sign of Reference State <sup>111</sup></p>
<p>Book No ...</p>
<p>BOOK OF RECORD SHEETS FOR NATIONAL CABOTAGE TRANSPORT<br>OPERATIONS CARRIED OUT UNDER CABOTAGE AUTHORIZATION<br>No. ...</p>
<p>This book is valid untii..............................................................</p>
<p>(2)</p>
<p>Issued at............................</p>
<p>date.....................................</p>
<p>(31</p>
<p>International distinguishing signs of Reference States are: Iceland (IS), Norway (N),<br>Finland (FIN), Sweden (S).</p>

<p>463</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>(b)</p>
<p>(Inside cover of book of record sheets)</p>
<p>1. &nbsp;&nbsp;(Translation in the other official languages of the Reference States of text overleaf)</p>
<p>2. &nbsp;&nbsp;(Text in the official language or languages of issuing Reference State)</p>
<p>General provisions</p>
<p>1. &nbsp;&nbsp;This book of record sheets contains 25 detachable sheets, numbered 1 to 25, on which<br>details must be given, at the time of loading, of all goods transported under the<br>cabotage authorization to which they reläte. Each book is numbered and that number is<br>marked on every page of the book.</p>
<p>2. &nbsp;&nbsp;The carrier is responsible for the proper completion of the records of national cabotage<br>operations.</p>
<p>3. &nbsp;&nbsp;The book must accompany the cabotage authorization to which it relätes and be kept<br>on board the vehicle travelling laden or unladen under the said authorization. It must be<br>produced whenever required by an authorized inspecting officer.</p>
<p>4. &nbsp;&nbsp;Record sheets must be used in numerical order and the successive loading operations<br>must be entered in chronological order.</p>
<p>5. &nbsp;&nbsp;Each item in the record sheet must be completed accurately and legibly by printing in<br>indelible ink.</p>
<p>6. &nbsp;&nbsp;Not later than eight days after the end of the month to which the sheet relätes, each<br>completed record sheet must be returned to the competent authority or agency of the<br>Reference State which issued this book. When an operation spans two census periods,<br>the date of loading determines the period which the record must cover (e.g. an<br>operation beginning towards the end of January and ending in the early part of February<br>should be included in the January return).</p>
<p>464</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>(c)</p>
<p>(Front of the page inserted before the 25 detachable sheets)</p>
<p>(Text in the official language or languages of the issuing<br>Reference State)</p>
<table border="1">
<tr><td></td><td>
<p>Explanatory notes</p></td></tr>
</table>
<p>The information to be given on the following sheets relätes to all goods transported under the<br>cabotage authorization to which this record book relätes.</p>
<p>A separate line on this sheet must be completed for each consignment of goods loaded.</p>

<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>ANNEX IV</p>
<p>TRANSPORT OPERATIONS CARRIED OUT IN......(QUARTER)......</p>
<p>(YEAR) UNDER COVER OF COMMUNITY, ICELANDIC, NORWEGIAN,<br>FINNISH AND SWEDISH CABOTAGE AUTHORIZATIONS ISSUED BY ............</p>
<p>(INTERNATIONAL DISTINGUISHING SIGN OF THE COUNTRY)</p>
<table border="1">
<tr><td>
<p>Country of loading and</p></td><td colspan="2">
<p>Number of</p></td></tr>
<tr><td>
<p>unloading</p></td><td>
<p>Tönnes carried</p></td><td>
<p>Tonnes/kilometres</p>
<p>(in thousands)</p></td></tr>

<p>468</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>APPENDIX 3</p>
<p>DOCUMENTS SET OUT IN THE ANNEXES TO</p>
<p>COMMISSION REGULATION (EEC) No 1839/92, AS ADAPTED</p>
<p>FOR THE PURPOSES OF THE EEA AGREEMENT</p>
<p>(SEE ADAPTATION (c) IN POINT 33 OF ANNEX Xm TO THE AGREEMENT)</p>
<p>469</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>ANNEX I A</p>
<p>First flyleaf<br></p>
<p>(Paper - A4)</p>
<p>To be worded in the official language(s) or one of the official languages of the carrier’s EFTA<br>State of establishment</p>
<p>ISSUING STATE</p>
<p>- International distinguishing sign - (’)</p>
<p>Competent authority</p>
<p>BOOK No<br></p>
<p>of waybills for shuttle services with accommodation<br>for international occasional services<br>carried out by coach and bus between the States that are either</p>
<p>EC Member States or EFTA States f) issued on the basis of Regulation (EEC) No 684/92, as adapted for the<br>purposes of the Agreement on the European Economic Area</p>
<p>to......................................................................................................................................</p>
<p>(Sumime and first name or trade name of carrier)</p>
<p>(Full address and telephone number)</p>
<p>(Place and date of issue)</p>
<p>(Signature and stamp of issuing authority or organization)</p>
<p>(<sup>!</sup>) Iceland (IS), Norway (N), Austria (A), Finland (FIN), Sweden (S).</p>
<p>(*) EC Member States are: Belgium, Denmark, Germany, Greece, Spain, France. Ireland. Italy, Luxembourg.<br>Netherlands, Portugal and United Kingdom.</p>
<p>EFTA States are: Iceland, Norway, Austria, Finland and Sweden.</p>
<p>470</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>Second flyleaf</p>
<p>To be worded in the official language(s) or one of the official languages of the<br>carrier's EFTA State of establishment</p>
<p>Important notice</p>
<p>A. COMMON PROVISIONS FOR SHUTTLE SERVICES WITH ACCOMMODATION AND FOR<br>OCCASIONAL SERVICES</p>
<p>1. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This waybill shall be valid for the entire journey.</p>
<p>2. &nbsp;&nbsp;The waybill enables the holder to carry out international shuttle services with<br>accommodation, international occasional services, and also to carry out local<br>excursions in an EC Member State or EFTA State other than the one in which they<br>are established. Such local excursions are only for non-resident passengers<br>previously transported by the same carrier on an international shuttle service with<br>accommodation or an international occasional service. The same vehicle or<br>another vehicle from the same carrier or group of carriers must be used.</p>
<p>3. &nbsp;&nbsp;The waybill shall be filled in duplicate, either by the carrier or by the driver for any<br>journey carried out in the form of a shuttle service with accommodation or in the<br>form of an international occasional service before the beginning of each journey.<br>Local excursions shall be filled in before the departure of the vehicle for the<br>excursion in question. The driver shall *eep the original on board the vehicle for<br>the duration of the journey and it shall be presented whenever requested by<br>enforcement officials.</p>
<p>4. &nbsp;&nbsp;The driver shall return the waybill to the carrier at the end of the journey in<br>question. The carrier is responsible for keeping the documents. They shall be<br>filled in legibly, in indelible letters.</p>
<p>5. &nbsp;&nbsp;In the case of a shuttle service with accommodation or an occasional service<br>provided by a group of carriers acting on behalf of the same contractor, and in<br>cases where the travellers catch a connection en route with a different carrier of<br>the same group, the original of the waybill shall be kept on the vehicle carrying out<br>the service. A copy of the waybill shall be kept at the base of each carrier<br>involved and a copy shall be sent to the authorities of the EC Member State or<br>EFTA State of establishment of the managing carrier in the month following the<br>one in which the service was carried out, except where the EC Member State or<br>EFTA State has exempted its carriers from this obligation in respect of one or<br>more EC Member States or EFTA States.</p>
<p>471</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>Third flyleaf</p>
<p>B. SHUTTLE SERVICES WITH ACCOMMODATION</p>
<p>1. &nbsp;&nbsp;By virtue of Article 2(2.1) and (2.2) of Regulation (EEC) No 684/92, as adapted<br>for the purposes of the Agreement on the European Economic Area, shuttle<br>services with accommodation are services organized to carry, by means of<br>repeated outward and return journeys, groups of passengers assembled in advance<br>from a single area of departure to a single area of destination.</p>
<p>Area of departure and area of destination mean respectively the place where the<br>journey begins and the place where the journey ends, together with, in each case,<br>localities within a radius of 50 km.</p>
<p>The areas of departure and destination and the additional picking-up and<br>setting-down points may be within the territory of one or more EC Member States<br>or EFTA States.</p>
<p>A group assembled in advance is a group for which a body or person responsible<br>in accordance with the rules of the State of establishment has taken charge of<br>conclusion of the contract or collective payment of the services or has received all<br>reservations and payments before the date of departure.</p>
<p>2. &nbsp;&nbsp;Shuttle services with accommodation shall include, in addition to transport,<br>accommodation for at least 80% of the passengers with or without meals, at the<br>place of destination and, where necessary, during the journey and the duration of<br>the passengers' stay at the place of destination shall be at least two nights.</p>
<p>3. &nbsp;&nbsp;In accordance with Article 14(1) of Regulation (EEC) No 684/92, as adapted for<br>the purposes of the Agreement on the European Economic Area, passengers using<br>a shuttle service shall throughout their journey possess transport tickets, either<br>individual or collective, which indicate:</p>
<p>- the points of departure and destination,</p>
<p>- the period of validity of the ticket, and</p>
<p>- the price of transport, the total price of the journey including accommodation,<br>and details of the accommodation.</p>
<p>472</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>OCCASIONAL SERVICES</p>
<p>1. Article 11(1), in conjunction with Article 4(1) of Regulation (EEC) No 684/92, as<br>adapted for the purposes of the Agreement on the European Economic Area,<br>States that in the case of occasional services, the following services shall be<br>carried out under cover of a control document, namely the services defined in<br>Article 2(3.1 )(a) to (c) of the Regulation, as adapted for the purposes of the<br>Agreement on the European Economic Area:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;tours, that is to say services whereby the same vehicle is used to carry one<br>or more groups of passengers previously assembled where each group is<br>brought back to its place of departure;</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;&nbsp;services:</p>
<p>- which are carried out for groups of passengers previously assembled,<br>where passengers are not brought back to their points of departure in the<br>course of the same journey, and</p>
<p>- which also cover, in those cases where there is a stay at the place of<br>destination, accommodation or other tourist services not ancillary to<br>carriage or accommodation;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;&nbsp;services organized on the occasion of special events such as seminars,<br>conferences and cultural or sporting events;</p>
<p>(d) &nbsp;&nbsp;the services listed below:</p>
<p>(i) &nbsp;&nbsp;closed-door tours, i.e. services carried out using the same vehicle,<br>which transports the same group of passengers throughout the journey<br>and brings them back to their place of departure;</p>
<p>(ii) &nbsp;&nbsp;services involving a laden journey from a place of departure to a place<br>of destination followed by an empty journey to the vehicle's place of<br>departure;</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>(iii) services preceded by an empty journey from one EC Member State or<br>EFTA State to another EC Member State or EFTA State within the<br>territory of which travellers are picked up, provided that those<br>travellers:</p>
<p>- are grouped by transport contracts concluded before their arrival in<br>the country in which they are picked up, or</p>
<p>- have previously been brought by the same carrier, under the<br>conditions set out in (d) (ii), to the country in which they are again<br>picked up and are transported out of that country, or</p>
<p>- have been invited to another EC Member State or EFTA State, the<br>transport costs being borne by the person inviting them. The<br>passengers must form a homogeneous group which must not have<br>been formed solely with the view to the journey in question.</p>
<p>A group assembled in advance is a group for which a body or person<br>responsible, in accordance with the rules of the State of establishment,<br>has taken charge of conclusion of the contract or collective payment of<br>the services or has received all reservations and payments before the<br>date of departure, and which consists of:</p>
<p>- either at least 12 people,</p>
<p>- or a number of people making up at least 40% of the vehicle's<br>capacity excluding the driver (Article 2(3.2)).</p>
<p>2. Occasional services shall not cease to be occasional services solely because they<br>are provided at certain intervals.</p>
<p>474</p>

<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>(Third page of application for authorization or for renewal of authorization)</p>
<p>Important notice</p>
<p>1. &nbsp;&nbsp;The following must be attached to the application, as appropriate:</p>
<p>(i) &nbsp;&nbsp;the timetable;</p>
<p>(ii) &nbsp;&nbsp;fare scales;</p>
<p>(iii) &nbsp;&nbsp;evidence that the applicant satisfies the requirements applicable in the</p>
<p>EC Member State or EFTA State of establishment to persons wishing to engage in<br>international road passenger transport;</p>
<p>(iv) &nbsp;information conceming the type and volume of traffic that the applicant plans to<br>carry if it is a new service or that he has carried if this is the renewal of an<br>authorization, and any other useful information;</p>
<p>(v) &nbsp;a map on an appropriate scale on which are marked out the route and the stopping<br>points at which passengers are to be taken up or set down.</p>
<p>2. &nbsp;&nbsp;Article 4(4) rid Article 13(1) of Regulation (EEC) No 684/92, as adapted for the<br>purposes o ie Agreement on the European Economic Area, State that the following<br>services art cubject to authorization:</p>
<p>(i) &nbsp;&nbsp;regular services;</p>
<p>(ii) &nbsp;shuttle services without accommodation;</p>
<p>(iii) &nbsp;&nbsp;residual occasional services, namely occasional services other than the following<br>services:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;&nbsp;tours, that is to say services whereby the same vehicle is used to carry one<br>or more groups of passengers previously assembled where each group is<br>brought back to its place of departure;</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;&nbsp;services:</p>
<p>- which are carried out for groups of passengers previously assembled<br>where passengers are not brought back to their points of departure in the<br>course of the same journey, and</p>
<p>- which also cover, in those cases where there is a stay at the place of<br>destination, -ccommodation or other tuurist services not ancillary to<br>carriage or accommodation.</p>
<p>477</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>(Fourth page of application for authorization or for renewal of authorization)</p>
<p>For the purposes of points (a) and (b), a group assembled in advance is a<br>group for which a body or person responsible, in accordance with the rules<br>of the State of establishment, has taken charge of conclusion of the contract<br>or collective payment of the services or has received all reservations and<br>payments before departure, and which consists of:</p>
<p>- either at least 12 people,</p>
<p>- or a number of people making up at least 40% of the vehicle's capacity,<br>excluding the driver;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;services organized on the occasion of special events such as seminars,<br>conferences and cultural or sporting events;</p>
<p>(d) &nbsp;services listed in the Annex to Regulation (EEC) No 684/92, as adapted for<br>the purposes of the Agreement on the European Economic Area, namely:</p>
<p>- closed-door tours, i.e. services carried out using the same vehicle, which<br>transports the same group of passengers throughout the journey and<br>brings them back to their place of departure;</p>
<p>- services involving a laden journey from a place of departure to a place of<br>destination followed by an empty journey to the vehicle's place of<br>departure;</p>
<p>- services preceded by an empty journey from one EC Member State or<br>EFTA State to another EC Member State or EFTA State within the<br>territory of which travellers are picked up, provided that those travellers:<br>= are grouped by transport contracts concluded before their arrival in</p>
<p>the country in which they are picked up,</p>
<p>= have previously been brought by the same carrier, under the<br>conditions set out in the second indent of subparagraph (d), to the<br>country in which they are again picked up and are transported out of<br>that country, or</p>
<p>= have been invited to another EC Member State or EFTA State, the<br>transport costs being borne by the person inviting them. The<br>passengers must form a homogeneous group which must not have<br>been formed solely with the view to the journey in question;</p>
<p>478</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>(Fifth page of application for authorization or for renewal of the authorization)</p>
<p>(iv) &nbsp;special regular services, namely special regular services other than the following<br>services:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;the carriage of workers between home and work;</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;&nbsp;carriage of school pupils and students to and from the educational<br>institution;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;&nbsp;the carriage of soldiers and their families between their State of origin and<br>the area of their barracks;</p>
<p>(d) &nbsp;&nbsp;urban carriage in frontier areas;</p>
<p>(v) &nbsp;&nbsp;services for own account other than the following services:</p>
<p>transport operations carried out by an undertaking for its own employees or by<br>a non-profit-makinc body for the transport of its members in connection with its<br>objectives provide' 3t:</p>
<p>- the transport act.. ty is only an ancillary activity for the undertaking or body,<br>and</p>
<p>- the vehicles used are the property of that undertaking or body or have been<br>obtained on deferred terms by them or have been the subject of a long-term<br>leasing contract and are driven by a member of the staff of the undertaking<br>or body.</p>
<p>3. &nbsp;&nbsp;The application shall be made to the competent authority of the EC Member State or<br>EFTA State from which the service departs, namely, the first pick-up point for<br>passengers, or in the case of a regular service, one of the service termini.</p>
<p>4. &nbsp;&nbsp;The maximum period of validity for authorization is five years for regular services and<br>two years for shuttle services without accommodation.</p>
<p>5. &nbsp;&nbsp;In the case of shuttle services without accommodation, groups of passengers may be<br>picked up and set down respectively at a maximum of three different places.</p>

<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>

<p>Important notice</p>

<p>2. &nbsp;&nbsp;The authorization or a copy certified by the issuing authority shall be kept on the vehicle<br>for the duration of the journey and shall be presented whenever enforcement officials so<br>request.</p>

<p>(<sup>3</sup>) Delete where not applicable.</p>
<p>483</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>(Second page of certificate)</p>
<p>(Part for the competent authority)</p>
<p>This constitutes a certificate within the meaning of Article 13 of Regulation (EEC) No 684/92,<br>as adapted for the purposes of the Agreement on the European Economic Area.</p>
<p>Duration of authorization: ..............................................................................................</p>
<p>on</p><img src="https://data.riksdagen.se/fil/GH03203/prop_199394__203-17.png" style="width:343pt;height:10pt;"/>
<p>(Siflnature and itamp of authority ieeuinfl certificate)</p>
<p>484</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>(Third page of certificate)</p>
<p>To be worded in the official language(s) or one of the official languages of the<br>EFTA State where the vehicle is registered</p>
<p>GENERAL PROVISIONS</p>
<p>1. &nbsp;&nbsp;Article 2(4) of Regulation (EEC) No 684/92, as adapted for the purposes of the<br>Agreement on the European Economic Area, States that:</p>
<p>&quot;Own account transport operations are those carried out by an undertaking for its own<br>employees or by a non-profit-making body for the transport of its members in<br>connection with its social objective provided that:</p>
<p>- the transport activity is only an ancillary activity for the undertaking or body,</p>
<p>- the vehicles used are the property of that undertaking or body or have been obtained<br>on deferred terms by them or have been the subject of a long-term leasing contract<br>and are driven by a member of the staff of the undertaking or body.&quot;</p>
<p>Article 13(1) of this Regulation, as adapted for the purposes of the Agreement on the<br>European Economic Area, States that:</p>
<p>&quot;Own account road transport operations defined in point 4 of Article 2 shall be exempt<br>from any system of authorization but shall be subject to a system of certificates.&quot;</p>
<p>2. &nbsp;&nbsp;The certificate entitles its holder to carry out international road transport operations for<br>own account. It is issued by the competent au’hority of the EC Member State or<br>EFTA State where the vehicle is registered and is valid for the entire journey, including<br>any transit journeys.</p>
<p>3. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The certificate shall be filled in in indelible Capital letters in triplicate by a member of the<br>undertaking or non-profit-making body and shall be completed by the authority<br>concerned. A copy shall be kept by the administration ani a copy shall be kept by the<br>undertaking or non-profit-making body. The driver shall keep the original or a certified<br>copy in the vehicle for the duration of any international journeys. It shall be presented<br>to the enforcement authorities whenever they so request. The undertaking or non-<br>profit-making body, as appropriate, shall be responsible for keeping the certificates.</p>
<p>485</p>

<p>MODEL FOR AUTHORIZATION REFERRED TO IN THE FIRST SUBPARAGRAPH OF ARTICLE 5</p>
<p>(Light orange paper, format DIN A4)</p>
<p>(First page of authorization)</p>
<p>(Text in (one of) the official language(s) of the EFTA State of establishment)</p>
<p>EFTA State of establishment - &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Competent authority</p>

<p>Authorization No..............</p>
<p>for national road passenger services for hire or reward in an EC Member State and EFTA State ( ) other than the<br>EFTA State of establishment (cabotage transport operations).</p>
<p>This authorization confirms that:</p><img src="https://data.riksdagen.se/fil/GH03203/prop_199394__203-18.png" style="width:11pt;height:12pt;"/>
<p>is authorized, in accordance with the Agreement on the L opean Economic Area, to operate national road<br>passenger services in the field of international transport.</p>
<p>The following restrictions are imposed following the penalties laid down:</p>
<p>EC Member State</p>
<p>or EFTA State in which<br>the restriction applies -<br>international distinguishing<br>sign (<sup>3</sup>)</p>
<p>This authorization is valid from ..................................................</p>
<p>Type and duration<br>of the restriction</p>
<p>to........................................................</p>
<p>Issued at...............................</p>
<p>date.......................................................................................................</p><img src="https://data.riksdagen.se/fil/GH03203/prop_199394__203-19.png" style="width:11pt;height:11pt;"/>
<p>(<sup>1</sup>) International distinguishing signs of EFTA States: Iceland (IS), Norway (N), Austria (A), Finland (FIN),<br>Sweden (S).</p>
<p>(') EC Member States are: Belgium, Denmark, Germany, Greece, Spain, France, Ireland, ttaly, Luxembourg,<br>Netherlands, Portugal, United Kingdom. EFTA States are: Iceland, Norway, Austria, Finland, Sweden.</p>
<p>(<sup>2</sup>) Name, or registered business name, and full address of carrier.</p>
<p>(<sup>3</sup>) International distinguishing signs of EC Member States and EFTA States: Belgium (B), Denmark (DK),<br>Germany (D), Greece (GR), Spain (E), France (F), Ireland (IRL), Italy (I), Luxembourg (L), Netherlands (NL),<br>Portugal (P), United Kingdom (GB). <p>487</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>(Second page of authorization)</p>
<p>(Text in (one of) the official language(s) of the EFTA State of establishment)</p>
<p>General provisions</p>
<p>This authorization permits cabotage transport operations in the EC Member States and<br>EFTA States, in accordance with Council Regulation (EEC) No 2454/92 of 23 July 1992<br>(Official Journal of the European Communities No L 251 of 29 August 1992, p. 1), as adapted<br>for the purposes of the Agreement on the European Economic Area, laying down the<br>conditions under which non-resident carriers may operate national road passenger transport<br>services within an EC Member State and EFTA State.</p>
<p>It is personal to the holder and non-transferable.</p>
<p>It may be withdrawn by the competent authority of the EFTA State of establishment, where<br>the carrier has in particular:</p>
<p>- failed to comply with all the conditions to which the issue of the authorization was<br>subject;</p>
<p>- given inaccurate information as regards data which were required for the issue or renewal<br>of the authorization.</p>
<p>The authorization or a certified copy may be withdrawn by the competent authority of any EC<br>Member State or EFTA State in the event of forgery.</p>
<p>The original of the authorization or a certified copy must be carried in the vehicle and must be<br>produced whenever required by an authorized inspecting officer.</p>
<p>488</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>ANNEX II</p>
<p>MODEL FOR BOOK OF JOURNEY FORMS REFERRED TO IN ARTICLE 6(4)</p>
<p>(Light orange paper, format DIN A4)</p>
<p>(Front cover of book of journey forms)</p>
<p>(Text in (one of) the official language(s) of the EFTA State of establishment)</p>
<p>EFTA State of establishment</p>
<p>International distinguishing<br>sign of EFTA State I<sup>1</sup>)</p>
<p>Competent authority or agency</p>
<p>Book No..............................</p>
<p>BOOK OF JOURNEY FORMS FOR CABOTAGE TRANSPORT OPERATIONS (PASSENGERS),<br>established in accordance with the provisions of Council Regulation (EEC) No 2454/92 of<br>23 July 1992 (Official Journal of the European Communities No L 251 of</p>
<p>29 August 1992, p. 1), as adapted for the purposes of the Agreement on the European<br>Economic Area, laying down the conditions under which non-resident carriers may operate<br>national road passenger transport services within an EC Member State and EFTA State (’).</p>
<p>This book is valid until ................................................</p>
<p>Issued at....................................................</p>
<p>Date</p><img src="https://data.riksdagen.se/fil/GH03203/prop_199394__203-20.png" style="width:13pt;height:13pt;"/>
<p>l<sup>1</sup>) International distinguishing signs of EFTA States: Iceland (IS), Norway (N), Austria (A),<br>Finland (FIN), Sweden (S).</p>
<p>(’) EC Member States are: Belgium, Denmark, Germany, Greece, Spain, France, Ireland,<br>Italy, Luxembourg, Netherlands, Portugal, United Kingdom. EFTA States are: Iceland,<br>Norway, Austria, Finland, Sweden.</p>
<p>(<sup>2</sup>) Stamp of the competent authority or agency issuing the book.</p>
<p>489</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>(Inside front cover of book of journey forms)</p>
<p>(Text in (one of) the official language(s) of the EFTA State of establishment)</p>
<p>General Provisions</p>
<p>1. &nbsp;&nbsp;This book contains 25 detachable sheets, numbered 1 to 25, one of which must be<br>completed before the beginning of the cabotage transport operation to which it relätes.<br>Each book is numbered and that number is marked on every page of the book.</p>
<p>However, in the case of the special regular services referred to in the second indent of<br>point 6 of these general provisions, the journey form must be completed in the form of<br>a monthly statement, indicating in 4 and 5 all the dates on which the services in<br>question were performed.</p>
<p>2. &nbsp;&nbsp;The carrier is responsible for the proper completion of the journey forms.</p>
<p>3. &nbsp;&nbsp;The journey form, together with a compilation of translations, must be carried in the<br>vehicle throughout the cabotage journey. It must be produced whenever required by an<br>authorized inspecting officer.</p>
<p>However, in the case of the special regular services referred to in the second indent of<br>point 6 of these general provisions, the contract between the carrier and the transport<br>organizer, or a certified copy of the contract, shall serve as the control document.</p>
<p>4. &nbsp;&nbsp;Each journey form must be completed legibly and in indelible ink.</p>
<p>5. &nbsp;&nbsp;The journey forms used must be sent to the competent authority or agency of the EFTA<br>State of establishment.</p>
<p>490</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>6. &nbsp;&nbsp;It should be noted that for:</p>
<p>- non-regular services, cabotage transport operations are restricted to closed-door<br>tours until 31 December 1995. All non-regular services may carry out cabotage<br>operations from that date;</p>
<p>- regular services, cabotage operations are restricted to special regular services carried<br>out in a frontier zone and intended for the carriage from home to work and vice versa<br>of workers and for the carriage from home to educational establishment and vice<br>versa of schoolchildren and students. Other regular services are excluded from<br>cabotage.</p>
<p>7. &nbsp;&nbsp;Cabotage transport operations shall be subject, save as otherwise provided in<br>Community regulations, as adapted for the purposes of the Agreement on the European<br>Economic Area, to the laws, regulations and administrative provisions in force in the<br>host EC Member State or EFTA State in the following areas:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;&nbsp;rates and conditions governing the transport contract;</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;weights and dimensions of road vehicles: such weights and dimensions may,<br>where appropriate, exceed those applicable in the carrier's EFTA State of<br>establishment, but they may under no circumstances exceed the technical<br>standards set out in the certificate of conformity;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;&nbsp;requirements relating to the carriage of certain categories of passengers, viz.<br>schoolchildren, children and persons with reduced mobility;</p>
<p>(d) &nbsp;&nbsp;driving and rest time;</p>
<p>(e) &nbsp;&nbsp;VAT (value added tax) or turnover tax on transport services.</p>
<p>8. &nbsp;&nbsp;The technical standards of construction and equipment which vehicles used to carry out<br>cabotage transport operations must meet shall be those laid down for vehicles put into<br>circulation in international transport.</p>
<p>491</p>

<p>32 Riksdagen 1993194. 1 saml. Nr 203. Bilagor</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>The provisions of the Regulation shall, for the purposes of the Agreement, be read<br>with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;in Article 17, introductory paragraph, the phrase &quot;pursuant to Article 7 of<br>Regulation (EEC) No 1534/91 ’ shall read &quot;either on its own initiative or at the<br>request of the other surveillance authority or a State falling within its<br>competence or of natural or legal persons claiming a legitimate interest&quot;;</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the following paragraph shall be added at the end of Article 17: &quot;The<br>competent surveillance authority may in such cases issue a decision in<br>accordance with Artides 6 and 8 of Regulation (EEC) No 17/62, or the<br>corresponding provisions envisaged in Protocol 21 to the EEA Agreement,<br>without any notification from the undertakings being required&quot;:</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Article 1 8 shall not apply;</p>
<p>(d) &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Article 19 shall not apply;</p>
<p>(e) &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Article 20 shall not apply;</p>
<p>(f) &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Article 21 shall read: &quot;This Act shall apply until 31 March 2003.&quot;.</p>
<p>(g) ACTS OF WHICH THE EC COMMISSION AND THE EFTA SURVEILLANCE AUTHORITY<br>SHALL TAKE DUE ACCOUNT</p>
<p>The following shall be added after point 25 (C/233/91 /p.2) as a new section:</p>
<p>&quot;GENERAL</p>
<p>I. The above acts were adopted by the EC Commission up to 31 July 1991.<br>Upon entry into force of the Agreement, corresponding acts are to be adopted<br>by the EFTA Surveillance Authority under Artides 5(2)(b) and 25 of the<br>Agreement between the EFTA States on the Establishment of a Surveillance<br>Authority and a Court of Justice. They are to be published in accordance with<br>the exchange of letters on publication of EEA relevant information.</p>
<p>498</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>II. As regards EEA relevant acts adopted by the EC Commission after</p>
<p>31 July 1991, the EFTA Surveillance Authority, in accordance with the powers<br>vested in it under the Agreement between the EFTA States on the<br>Establishment of a Surveillance Authority and a Court of Justice, is to adopt,<br>after consultations with the EC Commission, corresponding acts in order to<br>maintain equal conditions of competition. The acts adopted by the Commission<br>will not be integrated into this Annex but a reference to their publication in the<br>Official Journal of the European Community will be made in the EEA<br>Supplement to the Official Journal. The corresponding acts adopted by the<br>EFTA Surveillance Authority are to be published in the EEA Supplement to, and<br>the EEA Section of, the Official Journal. Both surveillance authorities shall take<br>due account of these acts in cases where they are competent under the<br>Agreement.'.</p>
<p>499</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>Annex 13</p>
<p>to Decision No 7/94<br>of the EEA Joint Committee</p>
<p>ANNEX XV (STATE AID) to the EEA Agreement shall be amended as specified below:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Public undertakings:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The following indent shall be added in point 1<br>(Commission Directive 80/723/EEC) before the adaptations:</p>
<p>393 L 0084: Commission Directive 93/84/EEC of 30 September 1993<br>(OJ No L 254, 12.10.1993, p. 16).'.</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The following adaptation shall be added in point 1<br>(Commission Directive 80/723/EEC):</p>
<p>&quot;(c) In Article 5a(3), second subparagraph, the phrase &quot;in the Member<br>States&quot; shall read &quot;in the EC Member States or EFTA States’.&quot;.</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The following new heading and new point shall be added after point 1 (Commission<br>Directive 80/723/EEC):</p>

<p>31.12.1991, p. 57).</p>
<p>The provisions of the Decision shall, for the purposes of the present Agreement, be<br>read with the following adaptations:</p>

<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>

<p>501</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>'GENERAL</p>
<p>I. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The above acts were adopted by the EC Commission up to 31 July 1991.<br>Upon entry into force of the Agreement, corresponding acts are to be adopted<br>by the EFTA Surveillance Authority under Artides 5(2)(b) and 24 of the<br>Agreement between the EFTA States on the Establishment of a Surveillance<br>Authority and a Court of Justice. They are to be published in accordance with<br>the exchange of letters on publication of EEA relevant information.</p>
<p>II. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As regards EEA relevant acts adopted by the EC Commission after</p>
<p>31 July 1991, the EFTA Surveillance Authority, in accordance with the powers<br>vested in it under the Agreement between the EFTA States on the<br>Establishment of a Surveillance Authority and a Court of Justice, is to adopt,<br>after consultation with the EC Commission, corresponding acts in order to<br>maintain equal conditions of competition. The acts adopted by the Commission<br>will not be integrated into this Annex. In their publication in the Official Journal<br>of the European Community indication will be given as to their relevance for the<br>EEA and a reference to this publication will be made in the EEA Supplement to<br>the Official Journal, the corresponding acts adopted by the EFTA Surveillance<br>Authority are to be published in the EEA Supplement to, and the EEA Section,<br>of, the official Journal. Both surveillance authorities shall take due account of<br>these acts in cases where they are competent under the Agreement.&quot;.</p>
<p>502</p>
<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203</h3>
<h3>Bilaga 2</h3>

<p>to Decision No 7/94<br>of the EEA Joint Committee</p>

<h3>Prop. 1993/94:203<br>Bilaga 2</h3>
<p>In the case of certificates to be granted in Belgium, in Italy and in Austria, the<br>date of 1 January 1985 shall be replaced by that of 1 January 1982.&quot;;</p>
<p>(c) the following paragraphs shall be added to Article 19:</p>
<p>&quot;3. If a basic patent in an EFTA State lapses, due to the expiry of its lawful<br>term, between 2 January 1993 and the date of entry into force of this<br>Regulation under this Agreement, the certificate shall take effect only with<br>respect to the time following the date of publication of the application for<br>the certificate. However, Article 13 shall apply as to the calculation of the<br>duration of the certificate.</p>
<p>4. &nbsp;In the case of paragraph 3, the application for a certificate shall be lodged<br>within two months of the date on which the Regulation enters into force in<br>the EFTA State concerned.</p>
<p>5. &nbsp;A certificate applied for in accordance with paragraph 3 shall not prevent<br>any third party who, between the lapse of the basic patent and the<br>publication of the application for a certificate, in good faith has commercially<br>used the invention or made serious preparations for such use, to continue<br>such use.&quot;.</p>
<p>7. 392 L 0100: Council Directive 92/100/EEC of 19 November 1992 on rental right<br>and lending right and on certain rights related to Copyright in the field of<br>intellectual property (OJ No L 346, 27.1 1.1992, p. 61).</p>

<p>Annex 16<br>to Decision No 7/94<br>of the EEA Joint Committee</p>
<p>Annex XVIII (HEALTH AND SAFETY AT WORK, LABOUR LAW, AND EQUAL TREATMENT<br>FOR MEN AND WOMEN) to the EEA Agreement shall be amended as specified below.</p>
<p>A. HEALTH AND SAFETY AT WORK</p>
<p>1. &nbsp;&nbsp;The following shall be added in point 15 (Council Directive 90/679/EEC):</p>
<p>&quot;, as amended by:</p>
<p>- 393 L 0088: Council Directive 93/88/EEC of 12 October 1993 (OJ No L 268,</p>
<p>29.10.1993, p. 71).”.</p>
